They taste a lot like another popular brand of cookie that is often found in vending machines.Pass the milk!FOLLOW UP: I wrote this review before my wife and college-age daughter got home and discovered these cookies. I don't think a pack of store cookies ever disappeared so fast. Again, probably won't be a regular purchase, but as an occasional indulgence, these are a hit!

This was an okay cookie.  It's more of a cross between a dry brownie and a soft cookie.  It was chewy, but I wouldn't say it was all that gooey as the name implies.  The double dose of chocolate and nuts are great for chocolate lovers, though.  And I did like the re-sealable package, so the cookies will stay soft longer.  If you like double chocolate cookies with nuts and/or Chips  cookies, you may like this one.  I liked them, but I did not love them.

I have quite a sweet-tooth and often have a very difficult time avoiding sweets, especially when they're free.  So when these Chips  Chewy Gooey Megafudge cookies showed up on Vine I had to give them a taste.  Needless to say I was not disappointed.  If you like rich chocolate packaged cookies then these bite sized snacks are for you.  Here are my thoughts;Pros+ Made with real chocolate.+ Bite sized cookie portions.+ Easy to open resealable package.Cons- Still have a bit of that artificial preservative packaged cookie taste.- 150 calories and 13 grams of sugar per serving (2 cookies = 1 serving).- White chocolate chips can be a little crunchy.- Not really very gooey.Generally I'm not a fan of packaged cookies but these were actually pretty good.  Sure you could still taste the artificial side of these treats but that's sort of expected.  If you're a chocolate lover and don't mind prepackaged cookies then these are worth a try.  If you prefer a more homemade tasting cookie then you'll probably want to give these pass.

As of this writing, June 26, 2011, this product, Chips ! Chewy Gooey Megafudge cookies, has been reviewed 165 times, the first being six days ago.  If you want to know more about the taste and texture of the cookies, stop reading this review now and read the other ones, because I have almost nothing to say that hasn't been said about the cookies themselves, except that I can go long periods of time without these cookies or any others.  Oh, and also, that where the package says, "Fudge Filled Soft Cookies," which is missing a hyphen, and elsewhere where it says, "FUDGE-FULLS," or perhaps "FUDGE FULLS," the cookie IS somewhat harder and gooier (or is it "gooeyer"?) in the core than elsewhere.  I my own personal self prefer the non-core parts.No, all I want to review is the packaging, because if you read every single review to date and the ones that are sure to follow you will find all you need to know about the contents thereof, whereas the subject of the package is rarely addressed, at least not as thoroughly as you no doubt want if you really have read all the other reviews about the cookies themselves.There's both good and bad in the packaging.  The wrapper appears to be Mylar or some other silver-colored plastic with a second layer of plastic that holds the labelling image, and inside is a molded plastic tray with exactly five cookies in each of exactly three bins for a total of an average of exactly a dozen or or a dozen and a half cookies.  Please don't quote me on this, because last time I did math I goofed it up and got in trouble, but I think the answer, at least according to Sesame Street, is 15 cookies.The way you open the wrapper to expose the goodies inside is to pull rightward on a tab at the left side of the top.  It's kinda' difficult to get at the cookies in the leftmost bin compared to the other two, but if this problem so thoroughly stumps you that you find yourself hauling out a chain saw or 911ing the fire department, you probably won't be able to figure out how to open that flap anyway.The neato aspect of that top flap is that when you close it, sticky strips on the perimeter of the bottom surface of the flap adhere nicely to matching strips of Mylar on the wrapper proper.  I can't prove it, but I'm guessing this will reduce evaporation of water from the cookies, which will keep them both moister or more less drier, or both, compared to the more normal ways of closing such a package.  Of course, designing and testing this improvement and paying for the new machinery to apply the stickum, not to mention the cost of the stickum itself, all cost money, and that cost has surely been passed down the chain of commerce to us consumers.  You get to decide whether it's worth it to you.  If you snarf down these cookies like a chocaholic trencherman, it won't be.  If you wish not to add to your body's load of excess sugars and fats and carbohydrates but can't resist buying this product to begin with -- and if you have the self-disclipline to eat only one or two a day -- this feature of keeping them fresher than if they were in a plain wrapper that can't close as hermetically might be worth it.The top of the package shows an enlarged photograph of part of one representative cookie, and elsewhere it shows three distinct bits that have been added to and show up distinctly in the dough.  Stupid me, I assumed the lighter-colored ones were nuts of some kind, but they are not.  I'm not saying it says anywhere on the packaging or on the Amazon product page that there are nuts in these cookies, I'm just telling you the assumption I made.  And I'm telling you it's wrong.  I'm not sure what the light-colored bits are a picture of, and maybe I don't care, but I admit I'm curious.  The same goes with these other bits depicted in the photograph.  They're more dark than the first bits I mentioned, but they have a kind of swirl in them.  I don't know what they are either, and maybe all the other reviewers have figured it out, but I haven't, and I am curious yet again.  The third type of bit in the cookie dough is what I am almost 90% sure is a chocolate chip.COOKIE VolumeThe several cookies I measured average so close to 1-15/16 of an inch across that I'm going to pretend that's the average, even though I've measured with calipers only seven of them.  The height measured at half the radius along, which seems a reasonably representative spot to choose, varies from approximately 0.243 inches to approximately 0.425 inches, with an average I will round a tiny bit down (less than the length of a human hair) to 3/8ths of an inch.  Geometry tell us that a cylinder with diameter 1.9375 inch and height 3/8th inch has a volume of pi times the radius squared times the height, which in this case is pi times (0.96875 squared) times 0.375.  According to my pencil (yes, I know calculators exist, but I still don't trust 'em), the volume of one cookie is just a touch smaller than 1.105616653 cubic inches.The volume of 15 cookies is simply the aforecalculated 1.105616653 cubic inches times 15, which is 0.071793289 gallons.  Yes, I've used up a lot of pencil lead doing these calculations, but I want to get it right this time, and the last five hours have NOT been wasted.TRAY VolumeThe width of the tray inside is 221 millimeters, the length 95 millimeters, and the depth 56.5 millimeters.  The volume, of course, is simply those three numbers multiplied, which, as if you didn't know, is 0.03979426 firkins.The rest of the math is simple.  You convert gallons to firkins and then compare total cookie volume to tray volume.  The result, which I dare you to challenge, is the number 3.3648301288323, which means that the tray volume is a little more than three times larger than the cookie volume.CONCLUSIONI am not an expert on the subject, but I think I am still allowed to wonder whether the outside dimensions of the package are meant to convey that there's a lot more cookie inside than it appears.  It seems obvious that if you can do that, you will sell more hogsheads of cookies per fortnight.If that is the intent of the people who decided on the exact packaging that I'm reviewing, and if it is not otherwise justifiable, then they are lying to us.  They are not lying by comission, because the package clearly states that the cookie contents weigh 10 ounces (283 grams), and I have verified that the contents of my exact package weigh not merely 10 ounces but rather 10.25 ounces, which is 2.5% heavier.No, they are lying only by omission, in that they do not state clearly or at all on the package that it is more than 3 times bigger than the cookies therein.I am thinking, by way of comparison, of plain old saltine crackers in four sleeves in a box.  When you look at that box you have a pretty good idea of how much volume in crackers you're gonna' get.  Even if the volume of that box is a full one third larger than the volume of the stacks of crackers therein, that's still 9 times more accurate than the Chips ! Chewy Gooey Megafudge cookies' box.I rate this product with the "It's OK" rating, three stars, because it seems just that.

The Chips  "Gooey" is a "brownie-like tasting cookie." I especially  liked the taste of the white chocolate contrasted to the surrounding rich dark chocolate. It invites dunking one in a cold glass of milk to make the chocolate experience linger even longer.I like the nutrition qualities, especially the 80 mg of Potassium.  A  serving (2 cookies) has only 21 grams of carbohydrate and 110 mg of sodium.  The 13 grams of sugar and 150 calories are a bit much for me but is acceptable if I eat only one serving.I did not like the package.  It was hard to open and then could not be resealed.  So in the dry climate where I live the cookies dry out unless you store them in another container.  However, in my house, the package did not last long.  My son and grandson emptied the package within a couple of days.I recommend Chips  Chewy Gooey Megafudge for people who can eat just one serving.  Grandchildren may need to be given limited servings, but they will love these cookies..

Not really impressed by these cookies. They are too sweet for me, and don't have much fudge flavor. Also, they are more soft and gooey than chewy. Maybe they're OK as a kid's desert, but I think adults will want something with more flavor.

This is an interesting cookie that seems to have more the consistency of cake than cookie. While it is soft, it's not chewy, it's also a little short on the gooey part; the fudge filling was there but I had to look for it. The chocolate chips use semi-sweet chocolate and the overall impression is of a soft, very chocolate cookie that's not all that sweet.For those who prefer somewhat less sweetness this cookie may provide a perfect answer. The cookies are good and it's all too easy to surpass the published serving size of two cookies. The two cookie serving has 150 calories of which 60 come from fat. I noticed that the major oil was palm oil followed farther down the ingredients list by coconut oil and lastly soybean oil. The sodium content for two cookies was 110 mg. There appear to be around 18 cookies in the bag, 9 servings.I'm of the opinion that these cookies are better suited for an adult's taste buds; I think they might go well with tea or coffee and they do offer something of an unexpected taste experience.

The Chips ! Chewy Gooey Megafudge cookie combines a rich, gooey chocolate fudge cookie with rich chocolate chips. It was great back in the day, even though I've since become more abstemious in my ways.

Okay, I just saw a review that said these cookies costed them 4 bucks.  I just bought a pack for a dollar fifty ($1.50).  So that stated.THESE COOKIES WERE FABULOUSLY DEEEEELICIOUS.  SMH.  OH SO SAD HOW DELICIOUS THESE THINGS ARE.  IF YOU LOVE CHOCOLATE THESE ARE FOR YOU!!!Now mind you when I saw and thought to buy these I thought of my last endeavor with nabisco and a new product.  Those horribly nasty chocolate covered oreos.  they were a waste of my money and I was pissed that I still had a whole pack left.  smh.But these cookies right here...  smh.  ridiculously delicious.  smh.  Mines were gooey, chewy, and oozing chocolate on my fingers as I ate them.  I just now looked to get another cookie out of this too small 10 ounce package and was pissed that I just ate the last one.  smh.But then maybe it's best that the pack is only 10 ounces.  cause being this good if there were more I'd inhale the whole package of that size just as quickly.Don't get discouraged by the white chips on the package.  The taste of chocolate in these cookies is so delicious and so intense that the white chips, (whatever they are) become nonexistent.I say this.  cause I don't like white chocolate, and it's one of the main reasons I was skeptical about buying these cookies.  buy them, try them for yourself.  Totally delicious.  If Nabisco continues to knock it out the park like this, maybe they'll make a comeback in my household.  cause I had stopped buying cookies from disappointment in what I've received in the recent past.

I think Nabisco has a different definition of "gooey" than I do. These aren't what I'd call gooey. They're moist(ish) and they have some semi-solid filling with the consistency of marzipan, but they're not gooey.They are delicious, though. Quite so. Chocolate is one of my favorite things in the universe, and while these aren't gourmet chocolate, they are decent American chocolate. If you enjoy devil's food, you'll like these.My only complaint is that these cookies seem to have fewer in the package than the non-gooey variety. Whether or not the filling is worth giving up a few cookies is up to you.

These are honestly the strangest cookies, but really delicious.  I don't know how they figured it out but the "gooey" feature of these cookies make them feel like they just came out of the oven even though they are room temperature.  They are certainly very chocolately and will meet your craving for something sinful anytime you open the box.

Sigh, the problem with getting tasty-looking samples from the Amazon Vine program is that once the delivery package is opened and the product put on the shelf, it's fair game for younger family members who are always hungry and looking for a treat.  And that's what happened here. In this case, our son grabbed it up.  Here's how the conversation went:Me:  Where are those "Chips !" cookies I put on the shelf?Son:  They were good!Me:  Yeah, but where's the package?  You ate ALL of them?Son:  Oops.  Sorry.Me:  I was supposed to review them for Amazon.  At least tell me something about them.Son:  Uh, they were REALLY GOOD!  Delicious!Well, there you have it.  If I had gotten a chance to try them, you would have gotten a more thoughtful and nuanced review (covering chewiness and sweetness and all sorts of other attributes), but you know what?  Maybe with a product like this, a simple enthusiastic declaration is the best endorsement.So, that's the opinion I'm filing here:  They were really good and delicious.I'm sure I'll agree with my kid's opinion when I eventually taste one myself.

The Chewy, Gooey Megafudge cookies, while unhealthy (75 calories and 3.5 grams of fat in each cookie) also are lacking in taste.  The artificially flavored chips are dry and not appealing.  While I wasn't expecting healthy (it is Chips ! cookies after all), I was hoping for at least a tasty cookie to help with the sense of guilt for eating it in the first place.  However, with the dual combination of a poor taste and unhealthiness, I cannot recommend these cookies.The resealable package is a plus (hence the second star) and saves having to use a chip-clip to keep the bag sealed, but you'd be preserving a dry, unappealing cookie.
I love cookies and chocolate, but these are gross. They taste to me like chemicals and sugar, and the fudge gooey-ness just means more chemical in my mouth. Ugh.

I tried these cookies and my first impression was rather positive: it's soft, super-chocolate tasting and a nice indulgent snack. Then after just eating two I felt it was a bit much. The cookie really tasted almost too sweet to the point of making me feel rather sick after eating just a few. There was also an odd aftertaste that gave me the feeling that (obviously) there are probably more chemicals packed into this cookie than there are natural, good ingredients. In all, these cookies are just okay but could be improved upon.

These Chips  cookies are as promised: soft and chocolate-filled.  They are very sweet, and the kids love them.  I'll admit that the adults had seconds, too.No, they aren't as good as homemade.  Or as good as premium cookies.  But if you're looking for any kind of standard packaged cookie, you're probably not looking for gourmet.

We all enjoyed these very chocolatey cookies!  They have a nice chewy texture and gooey center which complement each other well.  They may not be homemade, but they were still great with a glass of milk!

I was excited to try these cookies, because I love Nabisco's oatmeal choco-chips softbaked cookies. The first bite and even the first cookie was okay, but I noticed that it was very sweet.  Also, it wasn't quite as melt-in-my-mouth as I had expected. Instead, these cookies are a little too crumbly (rather than soft like the softbaked ones). That means the cookies weren't very moist, despite the fudge center, which I don't think there was much of anyway. Though I love chocolate, the texture and ultra-sweetness kept me from wanting to return to the box again and again. After two weeks, even with six people in the house, the box was still unfinished.

I thought this Chips  Chewy Gooey Megafudge product was pretty darn good. I was afraid that it would be too "chocolaty" or too sweet, but it's actually a pretty good balance. A few minor complaints is that the dough on the cookie crumbles a bit easily... especially around the edges. I would've liked it more cohesive. Also, the "fudge" core wasn't quite creamy enough, as far as the texture is concerned. The fudge also would've been better if it tasted more like "dark chocolate", but instead it tastes more like hot cocoa. Despite these observations, I think these are pretty delicious cookies and definitely worth a try.

Are you a chocolate lover?  I know, who isn't?  Well, this cookie is for you!  Who didn't grow up on Chips  cookies?  They were one of my favorites growing up.  And through the years Nabisco tweaked the original chocolate chip delight.  I remember when Chewy Chips  hit the market.  They quickly replaced the hard cookie I knew and loved.  There have been many variations of the chewy version through the years, and this one takes the cake.  A soft chocolate cookie, with a fudge center, accented by white and chocolate fudge chips.  The perfect cookie for the price point.  What are you waiting for?

One things for certain---the product description doesn's lie: these cookies ARE chewy, gooey, and packed with fudge.They are also far too sweet for an adult palate and the chewy texture makes them more brownie-like than you might enjoy.  Why not just have a brownie instead?That said, my 3-yr-old with the massive sweet tooth went through them like Sherman through Atlanta.

These cookies, while VERY chocolatey, have an artificial taste to them.  As the package promises, they are gooey...but not really moist as one would expect...the outer part is kind of dry and crumbly feeling in the mouth.  Not the worst cookie I've ever tasted, but I'll have no problem leaving these on the shelf!

I love everything about these cookies. They are ultra-rich and if you're a chocoholic, they'll be right up your alley.The flavor is good with no weird off-tastes like you get sometimes with such products. I also like the consistency. I tried dipping these munchies in both coffee and milk -- they're a winner either way.You want chocolate? You won't get hurt on those great cookies.Recommended.

but "Chips ! Chewy Gooey Megafudge" is TOO MUCH chocolate.  Seriously.  Milk doesn't even help.  In moments of weakness, I have been known to eat a whole package of chocolate chip cookies, with chocolate milk.  I was barely able to eat two of these goo-balls.  On one hand, maybe that's a good thing - it forced me to moderation.  But the truth is, I really didn't like them that much.Oh sure, they are chocolate, and that's really never a bad thing!  But these are just too much for my tastes.  The description is accurate:  they are chewy, they are gooey, they are fudge.  Basically, they are the Chips  chewy fudge cookies, slit open and filled with gooey fudge in the middle.Not bad - just WAY too far over the top for my taste.

These should be amazing.  Really, just look at that picture!  A chocolate chip cookie that is chewy on the outside and full of creamy fudge.  Good glory, I could go into a happy coma just thinking about it.Unfortunately, they are not so good.  The fudgey middle is actually just a bigger chocolate chip, and the cookie is more crumbly and dry than chewy.  The taste is heavily dominated by all of that chocolate, and the chocolate, while not bad, is not good enough to stand on its own.Don't break your heart by buying these.  Just look at the picture and dream.  If you must, but the Chocofudge variety instead.  I have eaten both (nom nom *cry* nom nom) and the Megafudge surprisingly has less flavor.

I was expecting something that tasted more like the traditional CHIPS AHOY brand cookie.....This is something akin to a Frankensteinian mishmash of SOFT BATCH cookies and semi-hard fudge. The cookie itself isn't bad, but it's amazingly crumbly. The few packages I tried were practically all crumbs, with very few whole cookies in them. The fudge center was FAR from "Gooey", it was more like a melted piece of hard fudge. The concept is nice, but the execution is terrible......

Chips  Chewy Gooey Megafudge Cookies. The name pretty much says it all. These fudge filled soft cookies are really chewy, gooey and full of fudgy morsels. They taste like a premium cookie that you'd buy at a bakery. Along with the great rich chocolate pieces you will also find small white chocolate chips also. The cookies are a smaller size, approximately two inches in diameter, which makes eating them neater than a larger cookie. Because of the softness, they do not break apart and crumble as other cookies often do either.The cookies are packaged in a convenient reclosable container which actually reseals itself very well (unlike some that I have tried to use). I opened and resealed the package at least six or seven times, and each time it completely closed and the cookies remained as fresh as the first time the package was opened.At 150 calories per two cookies, these are not a diet friendly product, but if you can possibly limit yourself to just two cookies (which is hard to do), you should be able to satisfy your sweet tooth and still keep your waistline in tact.I would certainly buy these cookies again and again. The taste is so good that they really could compete with cookies from a bakery.

It is not often that I get excited over a store bought cookie, but....  THESE ARE GREAT!  They are moist, chewy and above all... very Chocolaty!  Chips  did a great job of putting everything in a snack cookie that I am looking for.  If you love chocolate and are looking for that perfect companion to a cup of coffee or a cold glass of milk, this is your cookie.  I found myself wishing for a bigger package.

When you eat a Chips  Chewy cookie, you anticipate a certain texture and flavor.  This cookie does not have either.The texture was the thing I noticed first.  Yes, the cookie is chewy.  Yes, there is a vague moistness to the middle, which has creamy chocolate.  However, the cookie, as chewy as it is, had an unpleasant, dry texture to me.  I know, how can a cookie be chewy and dry at the same time?  I have no good answers.What I do know is that I tried these cookies on several different occasions.  I also had one other person try these cookies, and that person's opinion was identical to mine.  I also noticed that these cookies broke easily, suggesting that the dryness was more than the perception of my tongue.Was there anything positive about these cookies?  Yes, these cookies had several positive aspects, though those aspects failed to overcome the texture.  The thing I liked the most was the chunks of white chocolate.  The chunks tasted like nuts to me, and they were the best thing about the cookie.  I also liked that the cookies were chewy, even though the level of moisture seemed insufficient to me.  Lastly, I thought there was a reasonable taste of chocolate in the cookie.With all these positive aspects, the thing that bothered me most is that this cookie did not taste like a Chips  Chewy cookie.  The taste was just okay.  I am a big fan of Chips  Chewy cookies and I love the way they taste.  These cookies fell short of what I expect from a Chips  Chewy cookie.  Rather, the cookie tasted like an imitation or perhaps a cheap generic brand to me.There is a lot of competition in the cookie aisle.  There has to be 100 or more varieties of cookies available.  A new cookie, such as this one, should be phenomenally good to be able to win customers away from competing brands.  However, this cookie is not phenomenally good.  I predict that either this cookie will disappear from store shelves or its formula will change.  In the meantime, you may avoid this cookie in favor of the other, better choices that exist.Good luck!

The Chewy Gooey Megafudge from Chips  was all right, but I certainly thought it could have been better. I didn't notice any real chocolate chips, and the cookies seemed very dry. The taste was just acceptable. I think  that I could go to the store and find something I liked better, probably at a lower price.

Okay, they may not be the ones mom used to make, that you could smell baking from half a block away as I walked home from school (and yes, it was uphill both ways), but for pre-packaged cookies, these are very good indeed. Soft and chewy, they are great for dunking but don't require it like those rock-hard ones do. And they benefit greatly from 5 or so seconds in the microwave.

I am a sucker for sweet goodness.  I especially like soft cookie and when you combine fudge and gooey it is hard to go wrong.  Unfortunately I do believe something went wrong here.  The cookie is not the same consistency throughout.  It is more brittle on the inside than the outside.  The fudge is not particularly gooey and is rather flakey and not very sweet.  Counteract that with the cookie itself being more sweet than the fudge and I am not sure what to make of the cookie.  Overall not a cookie I will try again.  Definitely not best in class.

There aren't many cookies I don't like, so I may not be as objective as some people, but this cookie has great flavor. The only complaint I have about these Gooey Megafudge cookies is that they are a little dry. Nothing a little milk can't take care of though!

one expects actual chocolate chips but there aren't any and I expected a softer moister cookie.  Chocolate looking but lack good chocolate taste; neither brownie nor fudge softness. Dry and a bit chalky. Disappointing.

Chocolate chip cookies are a favorite around our house so I was eager to try these out.  My daughter seemed to like them.  Personally I found them a bit dry and really didn't want to eat to many of them. I have had better packaged cookies.

These cookies showed up and when I opened them it looked like somebody else had already been in them.  They were all shaken up and looked a bit beat up.Ok, so that's just how they looked.  That's where it gets a bit odd.  You take a bite and are immediately greeted with a dry-ish, crumbly texture, even though it is still kind of soft. As you chew it, the gooey chocolate inside changes it to a more pleasant texture that I thought tasted okay.  Not great.  But okay.  My wife actually had one of them and declared that she didn't need anymore, because "it wasn't worth the calories."  Fair enough.  So, I ate the rest.  However, I don't have plans to buy them any time soon.

How can something named "Chewy, Gooey Megafudge" be so bland and unexciting? I was expecting a decadent treat. I was all set for chewy, gooey, megafudge hedonism. Bring on the megafudge, Chips !What I got was a slightly chocolatey-tasting, soft cookie that is actually pretty dry. The cookies are rather small, perhaps the diameter of a silver dollar. That's fine because I prefer to have something on the smallish side for the occasional treat and although small, these cookies are nice and plump.But the cookies aren't really MEGAfudge at all, more like KINDAfudge. We all know that the picture on the package rarely matches up to the actual contents, but this cookie does not ooze a fudge filling when pulled apart. There is a bit of a creamy chocolate in the center, but these cookies are too small for any substantial amount of actual fudge. And throwing in the white chocolate chips managed to actually take away from the potential chocolatey goodness. Honestly, this cookie rates a "meh" on a scale of 1-10. It's not even bad enough to hate. If this cookie were on the free cookie plate by the water cooler at work, I'd eat it, but I wouldn't go out of my way to buy it for myself. Even my husband who is notorious for his sweet tooth said, "Eh, it's ok. I ate them because they were there."Another note - this cookie dried out quickly. Nabisco has a great idea with the self-sealing packaging, but neither that nor the fact that I also kept the package wrapped tightly in a Ziploc bag ('cause I'm paranoid like that) protected these cookies from drying out and going stale surprisingly quickly. If you're going to pump all those chemicals into my cookies, I should have fresh tasting cookies for quite a while. These cookies don't last long, and I wonder how they hold up in snack packs that some parents might buy for their kids' lunches?Ok, you don't try something called "chewy gooey megafudge" expecting any health benefits, but here are the nutritional facts:Nutrition Facts - 2 cookies - - 150 calories, 60 calories from fat, 7 grams of fat, 3.5 grams of saturated fat, 0 grams of trans fat, 1 gram of polyunsaturated fat, 2 grams of monounsaturated fat, 0 milligrams of cholesterol, 110 milligrams of sodium, 80 milligrams of potassium, 21 grams of carbohydrates, less than 1 gram of fiber, 13 grams of sugar, and 1 grams of protein)Considering how underwhelmed I was by the flavor, texture, and longevity of these cookies, they are just not worth the amount of fat and calories for a couple of small, rather bland cookies.I understand that there is a Chocofudge version of this cookie that is a more traditional chocolate chip cookie with a fudge filling. I'd try those but these KindaFudge cookies will not be in my grocery cart.

I should have known when I selected these packaged treats what they would taste like--overprocessed, high sugar, high calorie discs of nothingness. To compare these to real home baked cookies is like comparing real life to THE REAL HOUSEWIVES OF NEW JERSEY. There may be something to occupy your time for a moment or two, but there's no substance, and certainly no love, underneath the veneer.

Over the years, Chips  has gone from bad to worse.  Although these cookies don't taste bad, they are so small that it's not even worth the calories to eat them.  The package says a serving size is 31g.  How vague is that?  There are only 9 servings per package so that amounts to a few measly cookies.  At the price it's selling for, you'll be paying more for the packaging.But back to the cookie, if you love chocolate, then you are hit with a combination of chocolate cookie with white chocolate chips and a fudge center.  The cookie is not much to speak of but the fudge center tastes good.  Not as gooey as one would expect because the cookie is really small, hence not a lot of filling. I think kids with less discriminating tastes would like it.

Being prediabetic, I don't eat a lot of "store-boought" cookies, but I usually taste cookies that my husband buys.  I am quite fond of the regular Chips  cookies and think they are great to use to make ice cream sandwiches.  Being a former chocoholic, I was eager to try these new Chewy Gooey Megafudge cookies.  They did not disappoint!  The reason that I gave them only 4 stars is that they don't come close to tasting like a homemade cookie, which is my "gold standard."  My husband, who likes regular Chips  cookies, was not a big fan of the Chewy Gooey Megafudge variety.  His veiw is "why mess with a good product?"  I believe that this flavor cookie is a nice addition to the Chips  family.  I wouldn't want to give up regular Chips Ahaoy cookies, but if you like chocolate,  you'll probably like the new flavor!

I'll have to hand it to the advertisers: the product is exactly as advertised--- chewy, gooey, and mega in the fudge department. If that's what you like, that's great, but I found these to be cloyingly sweet, and the super-sweetness destroyed what could have been a nice chocolate flavor.The packaging was also strange. The cookies came in rows; seven cookies in one row, three in another, and so on. Not really a problem but very odd.The cookies are very soft and indeed have a very chewy texture. They are packed with truly gooey fudge (have a napkin on hand for these) with lots of chocolate flavor. If only they weren't so terribly sweet, this would be a fine product. As it stands, it's a sugar high--- and a messy one at that--- but not a product that I'd rush out to buy.

I'm a little skeptical of anything from Chips .  Let's face it, besides Famous Amos they are kind of the lowest common denominator of chocolate chip cookies.  That's what makes this new product such a surprising discovery.  This chocolate chocolate chip cookies with a creamy fudge center are really tasty and almost decadent.  My only complaints is that they tend to fall apart rather easily.Chocoholics take notice and give these a try!

Don't get me wrong, these cookies were good, but when you read 'Chewey Gooey Megafudge' you expect to be WOWed! These cookies were small and chocolaty, with a little creamy fudge filling, but didn't quite live up to the expectations we had from the packaging. Marketers need to be careful not to oversell their product with hype, because consumers have grown to expect more honesty in labeling. "small chocolate bites with creamy center" would have been more realistic.
This cookie was a mix between a gooey, chocolate brownie and a cookie! It doesn't get any better than that with a glass of milk. Love it, and at a decent price.

I wouldn't order these if you live in a warm-weather region and if it's summertime, as the issue I had arose in transportation.  The cookies appeared to have potential, but some of them melted together by the time I opened the package.  Inherently, the flavor was adversely affected, tasting non-distinctive and partially stale.  Perhaps these are okay to buy in the store, but I don't have a precise idea of their potential because of what happened to the package delivered to me.

These are gooey all right--they taste like uncooked cacao.  We were hoping for a chocolatey cookie that wasn't as rock hard as regular Chips-a-Hoy, but ended up getting a cookie that didn't taste entirely baked.  We didn't enjoy these.
wonderful chocolaty-ness with a melt in your mouth softness.  My kids really enjoyed these cookies.  Just the perfect consistency, with a perfect balance of chips and cookie combined.

My wife and kids LOVED these cookies! They are very tasty and have a nice fudge center. The only complaint is that a good 2/3 of the box was crumbs. This was due to shipping. I suppose if you ordered several boxes at once they would be better cushioned. As part of Vine we received just 1 box and it was fairly beat up.Overall we liked the cookies and would recommend them to chocolate lovers anywhere!Thank you for reading my review.

I would have to say these chips  cookies are pretty good. However, I am disappointed that they do not have more megafudge in them. They taste just like regular chips  cookies with a little bit of gooey fudge in them. If they had more fudge in them then they would be considered megafudge in my opinion. If you like chips  cookies then I think you will like these cookies as well but please don't expect a lot of gooey fudge in the middle. Overall I like the cookies but I deducted one star due to them being called megafudge instead of fudge.

I have been waiting for a packaged soft cookie that can recreate the melted yumminess ofchocolate chips in a fresh baked cookie. Nabisco has mastered the art of creating melted chipswith each bite, but that is as far as it goes.The overall goodness of this cookie is lacking- it tastes like a packaged cookie. Its softnessfools you into thinking fresh baked, yet when you take a bite, you are quickly reminded of thepreservatives that must be contained in each cookie.The cookie is not at all the size represented on the packaging. It is considerably smaller. Onceyou pick one up to eat, it crumbles into several pieces. Basically, it falls apart before you caneven take a bite.The packaging does contain a freshness seal so that after you open the pack, you will be able toreseal to ensure freshness.This cookie is getting two stars simply because I love the concept of melted chips in a packagedcookie but I think the title "Chewy" is a bit of a stretch. The more appropriate title would beCCCC-Crumbly Chocolate Chip Cookies!

First off - these don't ship well.  When I recieved my package (even though it was clearly sealed and had not been opened) it looked like there were several cookies missing, there was a lot of empty space in the package allowing the cookies that were in there to slide all over, and several were broken as a result.  If you really REALLY want to try these, I would look for them at the local store rather than buy online and have them shipped.That being said....I'm awfully glad I didn't actually pay for these.  I've never been a fan of Chips  cookies - even as a kid.  They're just so over-processed and artificial tasting.  I was hoping the extra blob of fudge in these might help make up for that, but not really.  I can't justify buying awful-tasting cookies when it's not that difficult to make your own, or even to buy from a local bakery which tastes a million times better and fresher.I cannot recommend these - they were not packaged well, and did not taste any better than I expected.
Not nearly as good as original Chips  or chewey Chips .  The cookies are very dry and crumbly.  The chocolate flavor is off - too artificial.

Although I really really really didn't like these, my kids didn't feel the same.  They liked the flavor and the texture and I hated both.  There was a strange chemical taste, perhaps from the preservatives needed to keep them soft. This flavor is the same as that in the other soft Chips  cookies so if you like those you may like these as well.  I like the crunchy Chips  much better.

QUICK SUMMARY: This highly fudgey cookie is addictive and was gobbled up at a party in no time. However, the cookies themselves are relatively small (just slightly larger than a Thin Mint or Oreo in diameter), and I/we did note a chemical taste not unlike that found in Chips Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies. You'll go through a package quickly both because of the deliciousness and that you really only get 15-18 relatively small cookies. More details follow...PACKAGING:(Note - I received this product through the Vine program and it is possible that packaging will change between the review version and final launch.)The outer wrap is a relatively standard Chips pack. Opening it involves lifting a tab on the front, which reveals three rows of cookies. While the cookies in my package were intact, I was initially shocked by how much air is in the package. Nabisco clearly re-used the tray from other cookie products, and these cookies do not fill the space. As such, they're probably prone to bounce around and crumble if treated poorly in shipment. The package can be re-sealed by pressing the flap back down and running a finger along the edge to adhere. The cookies didn't last long enough for me to judge whether the package truly prevents the cookies from becoming stale. The seal seems a little looser than I'd like.VISUAL IMPRESSION:The cookies look kind of shabby, to be honest. They don't look like they'd be very chocolaty. Also, the smaller size is quite striking if you're used to the size of a standard Chips . (This smaller size likely accounts for the large amount of airspace in the packaging.)FLAVOR:I was blown away by the taste of these. While there is a slight chemical taste, it is the same chemical taste found in any soft-style packaged cookie. The chemical taste is quickly replaced by an explosion of chocolate. One guest I shared these with noted that the cookie tasted a S'more minus the marshmallow. (Idea for Nabisco: S'more flavor!) I was initially concerned that the cookie would be too sweet, but the chocolate filling is kind of dark and semi-sweet which compliments the cookie perfectly. The cookies are also quite rich, and I found myself satisfied after a smaller quantity of cookies than normal.NUTRITION:Well, it's a cookie. You shouldn't be expecting a health food here. It's 150 calories per serving, and a serving is roughly 2 cookies. That seems fairly calorie-dense to me, but your perception may vary. Each serving has 21g of carbs, with 13g of those coming from sugar. There's no trans-fats, and the ingredients list sugar, not HFCS, as the main sweetening ingredient.QUANTITY/VALUE:At $4.32 a package, that's roughly 24-28 cents a cookie or around 50-56 cents a serving (2 cookies). While I didn't pay for this product directly, I have to say that I would not pay over $4 per package for these given the low quantity of cookies. I'd watch for a sale or lower price.

This is an interesting concept in a packaged cookie:  a chocolate chip cookie with a soft chocolate center.  The cookies are small, which is a big plus in my book (easy portion control).Personally, I liked the flavor and texture of the cookie better after heating it in the microwave for about 9 seconds.  Then, it tasted more like a just-baked chocolate chip cookie, when the chocolate chips are still melted, soft, and smooth.For me, these cookies were just a trifle too sweet, but others in my family liked them & children LOVED them, so I'll go with the majority & give them 4 stars for inventiveness.If you have young kids, they'll like these!

I'm particularly fond of soft chocolate chip cookies, so I never really enjoyed the regular Chips  cookies. I prefer my cookies moist and chewy.  Because they're chewy and not too sweet, I really enjoyed the new Chewy Gooey Chocofudge Chips .  They come close to fresh baked in taste and texture.  Though they're quite high in calories, so I'll just have to try not to eat too many at any one sitting.

My only complaint is that there are not enough of them in one bag :) These fudgy filled chocolate chip cookies will satisfy your chocolate craving in the traditional feel and texture of Chips , with an extra chocolaty filling. Recommended if you like Chips  chewy cookies and want an extra level of chocolate.

Lately Nabisco has been branding new products as new "styles" of existing products including "Ritz" and "Newtons" brands. Those products, while tasty, had little resemblance to the original products. These, however, are a logical extension of the "Chips !" brand.As far as the product itself, they are cookies. I don't expect them to have any healthy ingredients. I don't care what they are made of or how many calories they have.First impression: They are about 2" in diameter and have a dark, almost burnt look. The aroma is overwhelmingly sweet and of chocolate and vanilla.When the least bit warm, they are falling apart soft and melty. They firmed up when cooled down. The small chip bits in the cookie were almost an unnecessary addition, in my opinion. The center is not not gooey, but grainy, and almost crunchy.To me there was an overpowering fake chocolate taste, and an aftertaste that hung on far too long.All in all, I am not enamored enough with these to purchase them. They are too fragile and overpoweringly sweet for my taste.

I usually love Chips  products, but not these. The chocolate had a very funky aftertaste. I have to wonder if they were somehow affected by shipment, but I probably wouldn't chance buying them at the store. I usually don't have a problem with any type of cookie, but I gave these to my dad.

Whoever Photoshopped the cookie on the front of the package is a true talent and should probably help the bakers make something that looked similar. The cookies are much smaller and a lot less attractive than the illustration, but to be fair, they're not much different or any smaller than other Chewy Chips ! cookies.So once you get past the visible let down, the taste is at least on par or better than any other Chewy Chips ! cookie, plus it has the benefit of having chocolate in every bite. So if you like Chips ! and you like chocolate these will not disappoint you at all.

When I first opened these I was surprised by how small they were and also how many were broken. They are very crumbly so they fall apart easily.  I wasn't impressed by the taste, it's a chewy cookie with fudge in the middle, but you can tell it's not quality chocolate, just has a bland kind of taste.  My 5 year old seemed to enjoy them, but I wouldn't buy them again.

My wife and I have had a craving for some soft chocolate chip cookies, but both Chips 's and Keebler's didn't really hit the spot.  Then these came along.  They're kind of amazing due to the layer of fudge that is dispersed throughout the cookie's center.  It makes the cookie soft and chocolatey.To top it off, they ditched the High Fructose Corn Syrup for good ole' fashioned sugar. HFCS has been linked to obesity and certain sources have been found to be contaminated with mercury so I try to avoid it if I can.  It's good to see that snack makers are catching on.So, these may not be the greatest soft cookies around, but they are certainly high up on my list of store-bought soft cookies.  Mixed with ice cream, it's a seriously tasty treat.  I recommend.

Word of warning: I found these cookies to have a very strong "chemical" taste that made them near-inedible.  They weren't as bad as a lot of other prepackaged cookies I've had in the past, but they still had a very strong chemical taste that made them distinctly unappealing. If you're the sort of person who prefers more organic products, I'd stay clear of these.

See that ooey gooey chocolate stretching between the two pieces of cookie on bag? That doesn't happen, even when the cookies are warm. The chocolate is actually quite stiff and dry. Another one of those "got milk?" products. I like plain old Chips  and would stick with those before diving into these and being disappointed again.And I'm not alone -- people in my office weren't impressed either -- and we'll eat anything.

Whether or not you can bite into one of these Chips  cookies and enjoy a burst of gooey fudge is unknown to me because most of them were broken in shipping. However, I did eat the bigger pieces and they were fine, tasting a bit heavier on the chocolate than the conventional Chips  cookies I'm familiar.

Definitely a winner. There are two of us in this household, both seasoned cookie fans, and we tore through this package in almost no time (even though we're on a diet!). They don't taste as much like regular Chips  as I had thought; the chocolate in the center actually overpowers that flavor a good deal. Still, this was no bad thing, and they stand alone as their own tastiness.

These cookies are pretty good for a store-bought cookie.  Obviously, homemade cookies will always be better, but for a pre-packaged cookie, these Chips ! Chocofudge Cookies are pretty good.  I noted that they were perfectly soft right out of the package, and also pretty tasty.I'm now going to compare them to the original Chips ! Chocolate Chip cookies.  In terms of softness, these are much softer right out of the package than the original Chocolate Chip cookies.  The original Chocolate Chip cookies can be made very soft and nice if you stick them in the microwave for a little while, but the Chocofudge cookies are soft right out of the package.  I think the Chocofudge cookies are better tasting right out of the package too.  I also tested both in the microwave, and the Chocofudge cookies were also tastier this way.I do need to talk about price points though.  The Chocofudge cookies are pretty close to the same price as the original Chocolate Chip cookies in the stores that I checked, BUT you get much less quantity-wise from the Chocofudge cookie package.  In fact, the original Chocolate Chip cookies have about 5 oz. more cookies in them.  Of course, the fudge filling probably makes them a bit more expensive to manufacture, which would account for this marketing strategy, but do be aware of this if you're a big fan of the originals and you're thinking about switching to the Chocofudge variety.Well, that's about all I've got to say about these cookies.  They are fairly tasty for a packaged snack and they are pretty soft, which isn't common for store-bought cookies of any kind.  If you are a fan of the Chips ! brand, you'll probably love this new Chocofudge variety.  Just go ahead and give them a try!
I've ALWAYS been partial to chips  because of their soft chewy cookies, but these are truly awesome. Well worth the money. I wish they made a sugar free version with stevia though.

When you first pick up a package of Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocolate Fudge Cookies you may be a bit surprised at how light the package is - only 10 ounces - but don't be deceived.  The package may be light but it is filled with delicious cookies.  The cookies are on the small part - you can easily finish one in two bites - but they are yummy.  While the cookies aren't as gooey as advertised (they aren't messy to eat at all), they are indeed fudge filled - break a cookie in half and all you see is fudge.  In fact, there seems to be more fudge than cookie (there are chocolate chips on the cookies but I couldn't really taste them).  However, the fudge taste is never overwhelming - the combination of cookie and fudge is delicious.  I love the resealable package that keeps the cookies fresh although the cookies are so good they won't last long in my house and there's little chance they'll go stale.Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocolate Fudge Cookies are a tasty treat.Nutrition facts (serving size two cookies): calories 150 (calories from fat 60);  total fat - 11% daily value; saturated fat - 18% daily value; sodium - 5% daily value; potassium - 2% daily value; total carbohydrates - 7% daily value; dietary fiber - 3% daily value; iron 4%.

it sounds good, chocolate chip cookies with a gooey chocolate center - what's not to like?  the reality was a mushy, piece of chocolate ganache that was coated in a thick, overly moist layer of cookie crumbs.  it was fine, but nothing spectacular.

I've always liked Chips ! cookies and was excited to try these "gooey" ones!!  What could be better with chocolate chip cookies than more chocolate?  Unfortunately, for me, they just fell flat.  The chocolate "gooey" part was not very soft or, well, gooey and there wasn't much flavor to it, in my opinion.  I actually felt that it took away from the taste of the cookie as a whole.  I would have preferred eating a normal blue package chocolate chip cookie!!That being said, however, my late teen recently graduated high school son's friend LOVED the cookies!!  In fact, he asked if he could take them home as they were driving up north that weekend!  He felt they were delicious!So maybe it is my more mature taste buds, but these would definitely be a hit with teens!

"Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge," I liked these cookies. During the summer these are easy to prepare, just open the bag. I liked the fudge center. No summer oven heat. This could be real good crumbled on ice cream and put in the microwave for one second. It was very good for summer.  I like to play with mixing flavors.

I love chocolate chip cookies. The upside of these is that they are soft, and the chocolate in the middle makes them extra decadent. They are also the perfect two-bite size, in my opinion. The only downside is a little bit of a chemical taste, probably from the stuff that keeps them soft.

CHIPS AHOY! CHEWY GOOEY CHOCOFUDGE COOKIESWe love cookies and were excited to received these.  They are chock full of chocolate chips, extremely soft, definitely chewy, and for an added treat, there is a filling of chocolate fudge.  The only down side regarding these cookies are perhaps they are a little too soft -- when taking them out of the package to enjoy many of them simply fell apart in my hand.The packaging is attractive and eye-catching and has the new lift-end resealable package.  I find this type of packaging an easy opener, but always find the package does not stay sealed well and end up placing all the cookies in a plastic container or placing the entire package of cookies in a food storage bag to keep fresh.These cookies are good -- I don't think Chips ! ever disappoints.  However, they are not my favorite Chips ! cookie, [that would be the regular old plain chocoloate chip non-chewy, thank you] but they are worth every bite and every calorie.  For those of you watching calories, fat, sodium, etc -- you may enjoy two cookies for a total of 150 calories, total fat is seven grams, zero cholesterol, and sodium clocks in at 110mg.  There is no trans fat involved.  So you should definitely have more than two cookies -- go for it!If you like chocolate chip cookies and fudge, these cookies make for a nice combo.  They are delicious with a hot cup of coffee or tea or a tall ice cold glass of milk.  Dunking in milk was a bit sloppy since the cookies are so soft,  yet still highly recommended.All in all, not a bad cookie.Thank you.Pam

I'm already a fan of Chips  and if you love cookie dough, this one is for you! The middle is a nice chocolate center. It isn't dripping with gooey chocolate, but it is nice and soft - as if straight out of the oven. I didn't think they could improve on the soft Chips  but they certainly did!

I only feel ho-hum about these cookies. They seem like they are really more of a vessel for chocolate rather than a cookie. It seems that there is barely any of the chewy cookie and what is there doesn't have enough cookie flavor to it. The cookies are overwhelmed by the amount of chocolate in them.They also seemed a bit overpriced for a small package. Even though the outside package is about the same size as the regular chewy cookies, there are a few ounces less of actual product and a bit more packaging. I also found them in my local store for almost half the price listed here on Amazon.I found the cookies to be okay and easily finished off the package in a few days. My husband didn't care for them, so I have no one else to blame for eating all of the cookies. He prefers the regular Chips  cookies (non-chewy) and I found that I do, too. I saw these at the store and did not buy them after having tried them from Amazon. I don't see myself picking these up at my local store at any time even with a lower price.These cookies just didn't work for me.

These cookies are, as promised, chewy.  That's definitely their selling point.  The cookies feature a gooey chocolate core.  The cookies are not especially thick, but there's definitely a gooey layer in there.  These are VERY chocolatey cookies.  If you don't like a lot of chocolate, these are probably not the cookies for you.  That's not an issue for me.These are still no match for a homemade chocolate chip cookie, but if you're not inclined to bake, this is a reasonably good substitute.

I would say "chewy gooey" is taking it a little too far but the cookies are soft. I prefer them over the regular hard Chips  from my childhood. I like that they just have sugar instead of corn syrup. They are REALLY sweet though. It's a good thing that they're on the small side so it's not too overwhelming eating all that sugar. For the popular brands of cookies, this one is pretty good.The packaging has a nice feature where you can pull open the package from the front left side and reseal it so the cookies don't get stale.

I received these cookies as a sample to try out and I would have to say that I would consider these for purchase.  The cookies are billed as "gooey" cookies.  They aren't the most gooey inside cookies.  I would say that each cookie is bigger than a quarter but smaller than a silver dollar.  Somehow I remember Chips from my youth being bigger.  No matter, the cookies are still delicious.After I sampled the cookies, I put them out in the office breakroom and gave them a test.  Anything that lasts in the breakroom until noon is not that great.  These cookies didn't make in until 10am.  My co-workers loved them.I checked to see if there were any transfats in these cookies and didn't see any hydrogenated fats.  I might have missed something but it looks like they are transfat free.  Maybe I'd have to re-read the packaging but they looked solid.

These cookies are chewy and soft, but the inside layer is more like solid chocolate instead of creamy. The new packaging means you peel back the top layer of the package, one compartment at a time. The only problem is the cookies shift around and there were only two cookies in the front because they had slipped to the back. None were broken however. Despite the solid inner layer and the packaging, the cookies tasted good. I just think there were too few cookies for the size package.

These cookies are okay but they certainly aren't as good as the "Megafudge" ones which actually has a chocolate cookie.  Those cookies I loved but there seems to be something lacking in these cookies.  The flavor isn't as good and they don't smell all that wonderful either.I love the whole idea of the Chewy Gooey cookies and would recommend the Megafudge ones a lot higher than these Chocofudge ones.

I was afraid the chocolatey center to this cookie would simply overpower the cookie part and be mostly a big mouthful of chocolate . . . I was pleasantly surprised to find that the smooth center complimented the cookie part rather well, not too strong and a nice, smooth consistency.  I wouldn't pass these up as a snack for a road trip in a gas station or had an insatiable hankering for a cookie and didn't have time to bake my own but, frankly, there's nothin' like a homemade cookie and these don't come close to comparing.

Chewy Gooey Chocofudge cookies were more choco-fudge than cookies. I found them tasty and easy to chew. They did have a slight artificial taste to them and do contain palm oil, the ingredient that is harvested from the rain forests, but for store bought cookies, I liked them.

I was happy to get the chance to sample these "Chewy Gooey Chocofudge" cookies, but I'm sorry to report that they aren't so great, IMO.  The fudge filling is relatively tasty, but the cookie part has an odd artificial flavor that I didn't care for.  I know there's no substitute for homemade cookies, but I'd like the fact that a brand-name cookie is factory-made to be less obvious.

While my younger self would swear up and down that no such thing would ever be uttered, much less typed, regarding the amount of sugar in a snack, I have to disappoint that little boy I used to be. These cookies are indeed good, but they are just over the line of being too sweet to become a regular purchase. The standard chewy Chips  cookies are pretty darn close to being perfect. Adding in a fudge center might sound like a good idea, but it just ratchets up the sweetness. Don't get me wrong, the fudge is entirely too good, as is the cookie. It's just the injection of one into the other that makes it a bit too sweet for my aging palate. Nevertheless, in moderation, which is to say one to two cookies at a sitting instead of a half-dozen of the non-stuffed variety, is a nice capper to a packed lunch at work (just as it would be in a bag lunch for a school kid). I think this is a case of trying to improve perfection and falling a bit short of the original product. Kudos on the effort, but I will return to the prior incarnation.

The sweet-tooth in me took over at the mid-way mark of the commercial. DOH!!! I have to wonder if the advertising department has ever tried this cookie... it was chewy, soft, even mushy, but the center was a HUGE let down, can't see myself buying another box/bag. They were sweet, too sweet, it really wasn't a good sweet, more of a so sweet there's an aftertaste sweet. Might need to go back to the drawing board on this cookie... and quick... no point in pushing the envelope as to what your patrons will put up with in terms of deceptive advertising... Short of it... the cookie's a flop and the ad doesn't represent the actual end users product experience!

Children who can consume sweets by the pound will gladly go through a box of these with no issue.  My friend, an adult male who occasionally feels the need to snack - took about two days to consume the box of these.  These had the appearance of a smaller, thicker chips- chewy cookies.I personally didn't care for them, they were smaller than normal chips  cookies, and seemed damp.  The fudgy center didn't really seem fudgy at all but rather made the cookie seem more cakey.  The sweetness however was really kicked up a notch - they were so sweet it was almost painful.  Although this cookie seemed like a great idea, I'll stick with the chips- chewy cookies personally. These were too sweet for me and the dampness was just sort of strange and a bit unnerving.From a kid's perspective these are probably the greatest cookies available in a store (everyone knows that mom's and Grandma's cookies are the best).  But the majority of adults would probably prefer the original or chewy cookies.

I loved the "gooey" cookie line when they first came out. This edition has a nice chocolate-ish flavor but there's nothing 'chewy' about it. The cookie is too gooey to have a texture and all the cookies within the same compartment just smooshed together forming a cookie blob. This brings up the best use for a package of these cookies--if parents of a preschooler have ticked you off, give their kid a package of CHIPS AHOY! CHEWY GOOEY CHOCOFUDGE..and tell the little angel to make a monster cookie blob to eat and play with! If you are still of an age to play with your food this would be the cookie of choice to smear on the walls and mash on your face.(Seems kind harsh on the parents--if they have a preschooler, don't you think they've been punished enough?)The other "issue" is the crumbs. These cookies don't stand up to the rigors of the real world. About one third of the mass of the cookies in each compartment was disintegrated into crumbs. The crumbs don't have much flavor and they won't stick to the walls. What's the state of junk food coming to?No nutritional value, great sugar buzz and a high potential to make a mess--what's not to love here?

This are quite tasty cookies.  They have a fudge center and are very soft.  My only complaint is that they have a slightly artificial taste which is to be expected, I suppose.  While these are no replacement for fresh home baked cookies, they are a convenient substitute.

I eagerly anticipated these cookies.  Every once in a while I crave chocolate, the richer the better.  And what sounds better than a soft chocolate chip cookie, with a fudge center? Just apply those calories straight to my hips!At first I was not very fond of these cookies.  They do have an oddly artifical taste, and the chocolate is definitely not the highest in quality.  The fudge, instead of being "gooey" is actually a bit brittle and hard.  I took a bite and chucked the rest of the cookie.  At 75 calories and 3.5g fat for one itty bitty cookie, it's just not worth it.  However, I happened to leave a plate of these on our deck for my husband, thinking he'd like them more than I did.  What can I say, I couldn't help one more trial bite! After warming in the sun, the fudge center actually did become soft and gooey - much better!Overall, I'd sneak one if I happened upon a plate sitting out on the deck.  I would not go out of my way to purchase or eat these cookies otherwise, however.  For that kind of apply-to-bum calorie content, I'd go for an actual bite of quality chocolate.

I was so excited to get these cookies from the vine program.  I had seen the commericals on t.v., and I thought they looked yummy.  When I received the cookies, a lot of them were broken and/or stuck together.  The "gooey" aspect wasn't gooey but one big chip  of chocolate in the middle.  To me, they were too sweet and not the best quality of chocolate.  I am not a huge fan of the original, but I prefer them to this new cookie.  I would not buy these, but on a side note, my four year old and two year old seemed to like them.

but "Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge" is TOO MUCH chocolate.  Seriously.  Milk doesn't even help.  In moments of weakness, I have been known to eat a whole package of chocolate chip cookies, with chocolate milk.  I was barely able to eat two of these goo-balls.  On one hand, maybe that's a good thing - it forced me to moderation.  But the truth is, I really didn't like them that much.Oh sure, they are chocolate, and that's really never a bad thing!  But these are just too much for my tastes.  The description is accurate:  they are chewy, they are gooey, they are chocofudge.  Basically, they are the Chips  chewy chocolate chip cookies, slit open and filled with gooey fudge in the middle.Not bad - just WAY too far over the top for my taste.

If you want a chocolate bar, you should probably buy one.If you want chocolate chip cookie ice cream buy that,but I suggest if you want chocolate chip cookies,you should try another kind of cookie.Sort of an half baked cookie effect makes thesecookies although tasting very good,something you will eat too many off and too fast,both of which are not very healthy or desirable.

Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge / B004U43ZO0I received these cookies and their extra-chocolate counterparts at the same time, and I'm a little disappointed with both.I was skeptical that packaged cookies would be soft, but these cookies actually are very soft around the edges. Unfortunately, the mouth-feel is very unpleasant to me: they feel a little like wet bread in my mouth. Once the edges have fallen off, you hit the center core of fudge -- it's basically a hard chocolate disk inside the cookie that needs warming for a second or two in the microwave beforehand.These aren't the worst cookies I've ever eaten, but I didn't enjoy them at all and really wanted to throw them away after the first few had been eaten -- there's a strange aftertaste that I don't much care for. There's also a bit of a "fake chocolate" smell to the cookies that is unpleasant -- my husband took one sniff of each package and refused to try any, saying that they "smelled bad".I really like the idea these cookies represent, and I hope that Chips  can get the recipe right in their next attempt -- it's a good idea, but just doesn't quite come together in execution.NOTE: This review is based on a free Advance Review Copy of this product provided through Amazon Vine.~ Ana Mardoll

I haven't had a Chips  cookie in many, many, many years, so I honestly didn't know what to expect when I got these cookies.  Upon opening the (convenient and resealable) package, I saw many tiny cookies.  Each one is only a little over an inch in diameter, which is both a blessing and a curse:  being so small, you'll have to fight the impulse to eat a whole handful of them, knowing that the serving size is only two cookies (150 calories and 7 grams of fat per serving); however, the cookies are rich, so once you eat the requisite two cookies, you'll find yourself without the desire to eat any more.  The cookies themselves are soft and very sweet (13 grams of sugar per serving); the gooey center is less goo and more like a smear of chocolate.  It doesn't flow or ooze or look anything like the commercial makes it out to be.  I suppose if you wanted the center to be gooey, you could warm the cookie in the microwave for a few seconds; however, that would also make the rest of the cookie gooey as well, which kinda defeats the purpose.  On the downside, there's a slight metallic flavor to the cookie, along with a rather artificial taste; I don't know if all Chips  have that or if it's only limited to this particular type of cookie.  However, it's rather off-putting.  Normally, when I'm looking for a cookie fix, I buy the kind you can buy from a bakery, which has usually been freshly made just that morning, making the artificial aspect of the Chips  cookie even more pronounced.  Which is strange considering the ingredient list.  It's less offensive than most:  the ingredients are straight-forward and easy to pronounce, with none of the polysyllabic products which make one wonder if what's in the package is actual food and not, say, some sort of food-shaped plastic.  However, taken all together, unless I'm in the middle of a serious cookie craving and no other option is available, I won't be eating Chips  Chewy Gooey cookies again.

This was a good cookie. Not quite fudge tasting. More like a somewhat underbaked cookie out of the oven with melted choco chips. My daughter loves these type of cookies. I like crispy overbaked cookies and prefer the original crispy Chips . I do believe that this cookie will appeal to most consumers and would recommend it be purchased.

These cookies are soft, but not really chewy. They are more crumbly than chewy. They are chocolate chip cookies with a core of soft chocolate. Tasty, but very sweet and a little salty. Definitely for a chocolate lover. The chocolate may be little overpowering. They leave you thirsty, so you'll want something to drink available. They go great with milk. The cookies are smaller than your average Chips ! The cookies got a little beat up in the mail, but for the most part they held up well. Not my favorite, but still very enjoyable.
Just as described.  These are small cookies with a sweet and chewy center.  A tad too sweet for my taste, and there's a bit of an aftertaste, but they do make for a good afternoon snack.

Let's be honest.  If you are buying these, you are probably not buying them for yourself.  You are probably buying them for youngsters.  So, here is what you need to know.  These are basically just soft chocolate chip cookies.  The "gooey center" is only marginally noticeable, and it barely tastes like fudge.  However, kids seem to like them.  There are two up-sides to this product.  First, the cookies are quite small, which makes it easy to manage portions.  Second, the resealable package actually seems to work.  There is nothing special about these cookies.  Kids seem to like them, but kids will pretty much eat anything with sugar.  When you sneak a couple, you won't wind up with stale, hard cookies, but don't expect gourmet.

We were very excited to try these cookies, since the kids had already seen the commercials. Our daughter especially loves Chips , especially the soft ones. My first impression when eating one of these new cookies -- besides how small each cookie seems compared to the picture -- was that they're kind of like chocolate fig newtons. My wife was not thrilled with the aftertaste, much the the "presentaste." These cookies are okay, but not outstanding enough to make us changes from the Chips  we already buy and enjoy.

To me, these taste no different from the regular Chips ! chewy cookies. They have a very thin layer of "fudge" in the center, but it isn't gooey as the pictures show. It's similar to a layer of chocolate chips. The cookies taste like regular chocolate chip cookies, just with a little extra chocolate inside. The cookies themselves are pretty small, they're soft and moist, and they have a lot of chocolate in them. If you like regular soft Chips ! cookies, then you might very well like these. I'm not much of a fan, however, and I probably would not buy these at the store if given any sort of option.

I'm a long time fan of the original Chip  cookies; I've like them since I was a kid. I've also had the soft Chips , which are OK but still not as good as the original. So, when I set out to review Chewy Gooey Chocofudge, my expectations were not high, but I didn't expect them to taste THAT bad.In order to give a fair and balanced review, I sought help from two others: My mom and my teenage daughter. Mom and I were on the same page, not good. Certainly not horrible, but just not good. We are both experienced cookie bakers and both know that its very difficult for mass produced cookies to match up with home baked. We did take this into consideration.Number one: The cookies were somewhat soft, but they also crumbled when taking bites; "chewy" cookies are not suppose to do that. They were hardly "gooey". There is a bit fudge in the center, but gooey means that it pulls like hot cheese on a pizza. So, Nabisco, don't claim gooey if they're not! Finally, once swallowed, both my mom and I experienced an unpleasant and lingering aftertaste. Yucky to say the least.My daughter, though, thought they were wonderful! Or to quote, "They're da bomb!" So, I'll just take that as a five star review.Me: 2 starsMom: 2 starsDaughter: 5 stars.Overall: 3 stars.

Soft chewy cookie with a thin layer of equally soft layer of fudge in the center.  The flavor is good but slightly salty.  Not sure if I would have noticed the salt at all if I wasn't reviewing the product.  Best to eat with a glass of milk.  The texture is somewhat uneven.  Every cookie seems to have one tiny piece where the texture is unexpectedly harder, although there aren't any nuts in the cookie.I was afraid that gooey would mean you'd need to wash chocolate off of your fingers after eating the cookie, but that's not the case unless you decided to play with your food.There are 2 cookies per serving with a total of 150 calories.  9 servings per bag.  I don't recommend having these shipped.  The package isn't designed to prevent the cookies from bouncing around during shipment and a number of cookies arrived broken.Overall not a bad cookie, but I doubt that I'll be buying them.

Kudos to Nabisco for coming out with a new delicious cookie! Unlike the traditional Chips  cookie which is crunchy texture (and I'm not criticizing it, by the way), this one is chewy and has a fudge center in the middle in addition to the quintessential chocolate chips. My wife enjoyed it, too. We'll be looking for them at our supermarket (these went pretty quickly).

I enjoy the original Chips ! Real Chocolate Chip Cookies, 1.4-Ounce Single-Serve Bags (Pack of 48) on occasion, but hadn't had their soft version for a while, and figured I'd give these new, gooey cookies a try, since they looked appetizing. How wrong I was. Opening the package I was confronted by a cookie massacre. About 65-70% of the package was a mess of broken cookies, displaced cookies, crumbled to pieces cookies, mashed cookies; not a pretty sight at all. I go ahead and eat one, a little mess isn't going to change the taste, right? First thought, "Ugh, these aren't very good at all!" As I chew, other thoughts race through my brain. Like, umm, where's the promised goo? All I have in the middle is a sweet, imitation-tasting chocolate (imagine my surprise when I saw they used real chocolate!), chewy-ish piece of food that bears next to no resemblance to real chocolate. The rest of the cookie tastes stale, preservative-laden, and a bit mushy, not my idea of a good cookie. Last, but not least, while cookies are purely junk food, the calories for these horrible cookies are 150 for two, which comes out to 75 calories for a rather small cookie (about 2 inches in diameter)! As I always say, "If I'm going to put junk into my body, I want it to taste good." These do not.

The bright, colorful package with the big picture of the chocolate chip cookie with "chocofudge" oozing out of the center creates great expectations. Upon opening the wrapper, you see very small, misshapen cookies. Some are crumbled because the package is way too large for the contents, and the cookies fall over and get jostled and broken.I see that one of these small cookies is 75 calories, so it really has to be good to warrant the count. No way! They aren't chewy; they're mushy. The flavor is weird, sort of sweet and chemical. There is no clear chocolate flavor. Inside this small, thin cookie is a tiny solid dark mass; guess that is the "gooey" chocofudge. In sum, YUCK!These cookies besmirch the good name and reputation of Nabisco Chips !. I have eaten and will gladly consume "Chips !" cookies, but these don't come close to the quality of "Chips !". One "Chewy, Gooey Chips !" cookie is too much. Save the calories and your money for better.

These cookies are quite tasty and it's a very interesting gimmick. As someone else pointed out, you do expect a little more "goo" since the package says "Gooey". The chocolate fudge inside is about the consistency of a slightly melted chocolate chip cookie. These cookies are also smaller than regular Chips ! cookies, and I believe you get less per package, but they're still an interesting treat if you're a fan of chocolate.

It was pretty hard to judge the quality of the cookies because of the condition they arrived in: several were smashed into crumbs and none of them were oriented correctly in the container. They had that oily look that cookies acquire when they've been overheated. The packaging just doesn't seem well-suited to being shipped individually: the cookies have so much room to move inside the package that even with all the packaging Amazon fitted around it, they effectively self-destructed from the handling.That said, they were reasonably tasty soft cookies with an extra kick of chocolate in them. Nothing close to home made, but a decent alternative to other store-bought varieties.For comparison purposes, I picked up a pack of these from the local grocery store, and it was an entirely superior experience. Even the price was better than through Amazon.

This is a nice new twist on Chips  cookies. These cookies are a much, much softer version of regular chocolate chip cookies, to the point where the packaging has a big "gooey" label on it. After having a few, I can definitely agree that these are exceptionally soft cookies, much softer than the regular "soft" Chips  cookies. However, it seems like a lot of the other reviewers have complained that these cookies aren't "gooey" enough. I definitely don't agree. For a mass-produced, mass-marketed Nabisco product shipped to thousands of stores, I imagine this is about as gooey as you can make a cookies and still have it last to market. It's not quite "melting in your mouth," but it's not too far from that either. The flavor is also much richer than regular Chips  cookies. These have fudge in them, so there a much richer chocolate taste. Overall, if you like chocolate Chips  cookies, I suspect you'll love these. If you are picky about how "gooey" your cookie is, then store-bought just aren't ever going to be the same as homemade cookies in that respect.

These cookies are not for the calorie counters but for those who want a tasty snack regardless of the consequences.
