Just reading the label, Chocofudge & Chewy Gooey, is a tipoff that you will move the scale pointer further after sampling these treats. There are 18 cookies about the size of a silver dollar in a resealable package designed to provide easy access. Each of these little cookies contains 75 calories of which 30 are fat. You will not be able to eat just one cookie. You will eat a handful of these cookies with impunity and when you finish you will shed tears of regret at you lack of disipline.Super market purchase is the best way to obtain these cookies because they are not sturdy enough to withstand the rigorous handling of shipping companies. I received one package from the Vine program and although it was well packaged none of the cookies were whole. By not having a whole cookie I was able to gather numerous pieces and pretend that I was eating just one cookie although in my heart of hearts I knew it was a bald-faced lie. I am now back on my diet and exercise regimen with shameful feelings of remorse but with secret memories of these tasty treats.

I like Chips  cookies, both the soft and the hard ones, and I like fudge, so that's two positives already. These chewy gooey cookies are the soft kind with a filling of fudge in the middle. Unlike some of the other reviewers, I did not find any plasticky or unpleasant taste with mine, nor did I find the cookies half crumbled when I got them.I didn't give these are 5 because after trying them I found that I'd rather have stand alone chocolate chip cookies and stand alone fudge rather than both together. And I thought the cookie itself was ok, but the fudge wasn't fudgy enough. But apart from that, I thought they were pretty good.

Chips  and I go back a long way. I remember plowing through whole packages of them on any given Saturday afternoon. They're not gourmet or anything, but the crunchy sweetness was just about right for an indulgent snack.Quite honestly, the gooey "Chocofudge" Chips  don't live up to the nostalgia.Opening the package, the cookies smell delightful, a heady mix of vanilla and chocolate scent wafting out immediately. The cookies stick together, coming out in bunches of two or three, slightly oily to the touch. They feel a little like raw cookie dough, but on the tongue they're somewhat mealy and too soft. The chocolate chips are runny and the chocolate filling is more pasty than gooey, about the consistency of Nutella.Flavor-wise, these taste about average for a store-bought cookie off the shelf. The chocolate and vanilla you smell when you open the package are both there, but a little too sweet to be appreciated. There's a hint of chemical aftertaste too, which lingers.Overall, this is an average cookie, and the current Amazon price is steep for an average product. Over $4.50 per package is just too much...I might go for $3.00 or $2.50 per package, but not more.And if I'm buying Chips  anyway, I'm still going to opt for the original, that crunchy goodness that reminds me of lazy weekend afternoons.

This is definitely a downgrade from the standard chewy chocolate chip cookie.These cookies are supposed to be just like chewy chips  cookies filled with a "gooey fudgey" center.  There are three problems: first, the cookies appear a little burned when you open the pack.  Second, there are many more broken cookies than usual.  Finally, the center is not gooey, even at 80 degrees F.In fact, I microwaved a couple of cookies to see what I could do.  Even after just five seconds, the outside disintegrated, but the inside failed to get gooey.  I think there's just too little cookie and the center is too solid - it's about the consistency of the "stuff" in the middle of an oreo.Ok, so it can't all be bad, right?  Well, the cookie isn't even as good as regular ones because it's a bit burnt and greasy, and the fudgey bit in the middle is tasty but not really good enough.  The main issue is that the cookie isn't structurally sound enough to stay intact around that "gooey fudgey" center, and the middle part isn't better than the cookie it replaces.So I did what anyone would do and took them into work to get rid of them.  They lasted a shade under 4 hours on a floor of 30 people, and there were a lot of small pieces left behind.  I got comments ranging from "that hit the spot" through to "even as free cookies go, I've had much better."I won't be getting them again.

These are soft and chocolaty, and I like them better than the crunchy chips , but they still have that store-bought taste.The packaging seems to be too big for the cookies, as a consequence they were a jumbled mess, I normally check the nutrition info and then divide by the members of the family to see how many each person gets, but so many of them were broken that it didn't end very well this time.I realize that contents are shrinking and the manufacturers are trying to make it LOOK like more, but I for one would prefer not to be treated like an imbecile who won't notice that the packaging would hold 50-75% more than is actually in there.Other than that, these are my favorite chips , since I prefer soft cookies, and while they can't hold a candle to home made, I'm not turning the oven on more than I have to in summer, so I'll be buying these again (and again) in the future.

I'm not a huge sweets fan, prefer chips and such normally, but every once in a while, like just about everyone, a sweet tooth bites me and I want something with some sugar in it.Having grown up in a family known for baking (grandmother used to make wedding cakes profesionally), cookies are nothing new.  And a good chocolate chip cookie can hit the spot sometimes, even for those of us who aren't THAT fond of chocolate.So the Chips  cookies here are a variation I haven't tried in their product line before.The cookie dough itself is about normal for them, not quite great but not bad, either.  A little squishier than I'd normally want, but these are supposed to be gooey after all, so that comes with the territory.And while the picture on the package shows something with just oodles of chocolate in the middle, while I think everyone knows it's a given that the picture is an exaggeration, I have to say it's not exaggerating by MUCH...  There's a LOT of chocolate in there compared to any other chocolate chip cookie.  For me, it was overwhelming, way too much chocolate.  My 7 year old said the same, took a bite, made a face, and threw the rest of it away.But these aren't being marketed to people who don't like chocolate, so our problem shouldn't be an issue with anyone that purchases these.Chocolate is pretty normal tasting mass produced cookie type of chocolate, with a pretty smooth consistency to it.  Again, nothing to rejoice about, but if you like a lot of chocolate in your chocolate chip cookiess, it will definitely float your boat.They're about the size of a silver dollar, give or take, so they're not very large, but given how sweet they are, I think anything larger would be overkill.If you like store bought prepackaged cookies, these should be just fine, if not a little better tasting than most of the other options.

Most people are on one side or the other when it comes to chocolate chip cookies - crispy or chewy.  When it comes to homemade chocolate chip cookies, I am definitely in the chewy camp.  So I was very excited to try this version of Chips .  Unfortunately, I was very disappointed.  As far as store bought cookies go, the regular Chips  are very good.  But the chewy just does not translate well to a store bought cookie.  It is more like a soft regular cookie, but not in a good way.  It is similar to stale Chips .  Sorry, but they were just not for me

I eat very few sweets, and haven't had a Chips  cookie in many years. But I remember some good ones. I looked forward to sampling these. I tried one. First thing I noticed is how dry the cookie dough was. It is soft, but after a bite or two I reached for a drink. The dough was just dry, and what I was searching for was some flavor. There might have been some, but I may have imagined it. Next, the inside. It is a bit gooey, and consists of a thin layer of chocolate fudgey filling. Very thin. I was surprised again at how little flavor I detected. I expected a rush of sweet sensation, because as I stated I seldom eat sweets. Usually when I do eat something with a lot of sugar, I immediately notice it. Not so here. There was a little chocolate flavor, to be fair. But far less than I was expecting. And hoping for. These reminded me of standard issue packaged cookies.Kids will probably eat these readily, without complaint. I'm not sure that's a reliable method of evaluation. Or maybe someone who regularly eats cookies is in a better position to grade these. Problem is, I used to be one of those people. I still remember the many happy moments between me and my cookies. And some of them were Chips . But they weren't like these. I know if I am going to indulge in a cookie, I'll reach past these to whatever other options are available.

Ok, I haven't probably had a chips  cookie since I was a kid or close to it, so I thought I'd give these new chewy gooey chocolate ones a go.  Here are the likes:  They are soft and chewy and the middle is nice and fudgy.  Dislikes: small cookies-2 cookies are a serving size and 150 calories and these cookies are about the size of a silver dollar, the cookies though soft and fudgy on the inside are dry on the top, if they were just a bit softer and less dry they would remind me of how fresh out of the oven cookies get that nice melty center when you hit the chocolate chips.  So, for me, this cookie is not quite there.  I didn't dislike them, but I wouldn't run out and buy a bunch of them.  If they were less dry I might purchase in the future.

I saw the name "Chips !" and thought of delicious, crispy chocolate chippy goodness. Alas, these don't live up to the brand name.I rarely buy storebought cookies, honestly, so I really looked forward to trying these as a treat. Here's my three cents:1. The filling is not very noticeable except as a faintly chemical, chocolate-like slime. There wasn't much filling, either (and it does not, for the record, look at all like the package advertises when breaking the cookie in two). The last two days were quite warm and the cookies became almost liquid on contact with warm fingers. Quite a mess, especially with kids. In short, the gooey filling seems to me a gimmick.2. I do like these better than the other chocolate fudge flavour they have, but not by much.3. Despite not really caring for them, they WERE very addicting, and considering the calorie/fat content, this was hardly a good thing.If I want a tender cookie, I can make better ones myself from scratch. If I'm going to buy a chocolate chip cookie, I'll stick with the original crispy Chips .

If you want a chocolate chip cookie, this works, but it was too gooey and rich/sweet for my taste, plus a lot of calories for one cookie. But, since I didn't particularly care for the taste, one cookie was enough. So, I'd say the world doesn't need this cookie, but it's OK.

I'm sorry to say I will not be buying these cookies. Upon opening the re-closeable packaging, I discovered the cookies were tossed around in their compartments as well as being broken and crumbled. I tried two cookies as did my husband and 12yr old daughter; none of us were excited by them.I felt they had an odd taste - nothing at all like the regular Chips  and not the same taste as a homemade soft cookie. My husband who loves soft cookies also didn't care for them. My 12yo daughter liked the cookies but felt they were too small in size. The package has only 18 cookies meaning each only weighs a little over 1/2 ounce. I also feel they are overpriced - I will not pay nearly $5 for a small package of cookies - that's more expensive than Girl Scout cookies.

These are OK cookies. Nothing really stands out, however. They are very sweet, even for store bough mass-produced cookies. So sweet that it's unpleasant after a couple of cookies unless you have it in combination with something else (for me, tea). The texture is nice - soft and chewy - but it needs something to break up the softness. This is a cookie that just cries out for nuts to be added.The flavor is hard to pin down due to the heavy sweetness. There's somewhat of a poor aftertaste as well.But, the bottom line with judging the appeal of any cookie in my households is two-fold: are there any left over in the bag a short while after it's opened?; and do people want more after they are gone? The answer to both of those questions is no - while they were all snarfed up, there was no interest in getting more the next time at the grocery store. So, three stars. Not bad; not memorable either.

The chocolate filling inside is a little softer than the chocolate chips which is nice, but the flavor the the entire cookie tastes a bit like preservatives took a strong role in the ingredients. I flavor of the cookie is about the same as a regular Chips ! cookie. The cookie dough part is softer than standard Chips ! cookie making slightly better then the crumbly counterparts.

I really thought the combination would work well but found the fudge inside making the chocolate chip cookie a little to sweet.  I think I prefer them just the way they are.  Why mess with perfection?  They were always good so leave them that way.  I do enjoy cream filled cookies but dont think the chips  need them they were just fine.  Not like an oreo which needs them.

These cookies are not bad but I expected more from Chips . The reason I love their regular cookies so much is because they are crunchy. These are not, they are very soft and chewy and that is not a texture I love in a cookie. While these cookies aren't crunchy, the chocofudge in the middle is a nice and added treat. It would be nice if the original crunchy cookies had this middle and then they would have a homerun on their hands. As it stands, these cookies are just okay.

My kids really loved this cookie, perhaps because we don't buy many soft baked cookies. The cookies are moist and soft, with a layer of chocolate in the center. Since it was warm when they tried it, the chocolate (there's a lot of it) easily melted. My kids thought this cookie was great, lots of chocolate! I found them a bit grainy and lacking in texture, making them merely okay. Since I'm not used to soft baked cookies this might just be a personal preference. Overall, it's a cookie; of course it is good! Yet I wish it was just a bit better. Sill, if you enjoy chocolate you might enjoy this.

I thought these cookies were okay. They're actually much smaller than how they appear on the package, I expected them to be larger.  Their flavor is okay, but I wouldn't say they tasted great. The inside wasn't that gooey as they advertise on the package. I would grade this product as average.

After receiving these today, I once again gathered the household testers together (aka, the missus and munchkins) to try these cookies.First, let me describe them. (The cookies, not the testers!  :-) )  They are about two inches across, maybe an eight of an inch thick, and are a darker brown than shown on the package.  Inside the cookie is a thin layer of fudge. The cookies have a bit of a dampish-texture and were all stuck together.The taste of the "outside" part of the cookie was slighly similar to soft-baked chocolate chip cookies.  However, the texture was a bit "grainy", somewhat like an soft oatmeal cookie.  The fudge layer on the inside was tasty, but was a little overpowered by the rest of the cookie.  It wasn't quite as firm as the layer you'd find in an oreo cookie, and was more like a spread.I love chocolate chip cookies, and I love fudge, so I had high hopes for these.  My wife has similar tastes and also thought they'd be a good cookie to try.  However, the testers and I unanimously agree that they are somewhat mediocre in taste and appearance.  While they aren't terrible by any means, they didn't grab me enough to make me want to go out and get more.  Everyone's taste is different, though, so you may love them.  I give these cookies a three star rating ... that is to say they're not good, they're not bad, they're only fair.As an aside, I received these cookies to evaluate as part of the Amazon Vine program.  The Amazon shipping container was very well protected and undamaged, but when I opened the pack of cookies, about a third of them had been reduced to crumbs, and only two thirds of them were in a condition to eat.  (And those were all stuck together.)  I don't know if that was due to rough handling or excessive heat during shipment, so I didn't consider it as part of my rating.  I only mention it as something to watch for in the event that it's a flaw in the cookie itself.

These Chocolate Chip cookies are so good. Chips  has made this cookie chewey and tastey. This in one of my favorite cookies...ever. They will be very difficult to keep in stock. They are yummy goodness.

First let me say that I am big fan of regular crunchy Chips , and I esp. love the Chips  cookies with Heath bars in them, so I was excited to try these out.Although my cookies arrived more as bits of cookie in a bag, I wasn't upset because that can happen, and bits of cookies can taste every bit as good as whole cookies.Except in this case.  First, the cookies that were whole were quite a bit on the tiny side, and at a serving size of 2 cookies, you'll be getting 150 calories and 7 grams of fat.  That would be acceptable if these cookies were delectable.But they're not.  I didn't like them at all.  I thought they weren't very flavorful, and the chocolate fudge left a lot to be desired.  But worst all was the bitter, acrid aftertaste.I think Nabisco would do well to go back to the drawing board on these cookies, because what they have here is not working.  I'm sorry.

I like soft-baked chocolate chip cookies, and these Chips  Gooey cookies are very tasty.  If you can stop at eating just two, you'll end up with a moderate 15 grams of sugar in your system.If you keep eating, however, like I did, you may find these veer a little close to being candy.  The fudgy filling is pretty sweet and there is not a lot of cookie to  back it up.  I feel a little sick after eating five of them.Tasty, but a little too sweet for me.

These Chips  chewy gooey chocofudge cookies are extremely delicate and easily break apart if not removed carefully from the resealable bag. However, they are just so good, so chocolately, and so gooey soft without being gooey in the "sticky sense" of the word. There's also a thin layer of fudge in the center of each cookie.  Two small cookies will set you back about 150 calories with 60 calories from fat. There are about 18 cookies in a bag.Taste-wise they are great especially as a once-in-a-while treat for those who are more health concious.  I know they satisified my chocolate craving and were hard to stop eating once I started.

We keep a constant stock of Chips  'original' cookies in out candy cabinet. We've tried all the variations that have come by, but we always end up returning to the 'original'. The Chewy Gooey Chocofudge cookies are pretty much just their softer cookies, filled with fudge. I like the softer Chips  cookies, but never enough to repurchase them... I always considered them to be pretty 'boring'. These, however, with the perfect amount of fudge added are a LOT better. A vast improvement over the standard soft cookie. They also have an addicting 'crunch' from the chips (I like interesting textures in foods).I usually have 3-4 cookies with lunch, but with these I ended up downing 12 of them. That's when the bad news hit me. If you look at the nutritional information on the package, you would think that there is actually less calories and fat per serving, but then you notice that the serving size is two cookies, while the Originals have a serving size of three. The Original Chips  have about 53 calories and 2.7 grams of fat per cookie. The Chewy Gooey Chocofudge cookies have 75 calories and 3.5 grams of fat each! Wow, I realized I finished off my lunch with a 900-calorie 'snack'. I don't have any need to watch my weight, but after finding out how much they will 'cost' you, my wife won't even look at them.These are definitely very good cookies, but they still aren't a replacement for my Originals.

I typically don't like soft cookies. I prefer crisp, thin cookies. So, I was pleasantly surprised when I bit into Chips  Gooey Chocofudge. The chocolate chip distribution was excellent, (not sparse and stingy like other brands.) And the addition of the thin layer of fudge on the inside was a sweet, velvety experience. I ate one, then another, and then a whole row was gone. Needless to say, I won't be buying these cookies again because I can't trust myself to eat just one. :/ Fudge.

At my house, I am known as the Cookie Monster.  I love cookies and bake cookies, too.  Chips ! (original) are one of my favorites.However, these are quite disappointing.  The packaging size and pictures are very misleading.  The cookies themselves are scarcely bigger than those "toy" cookies you get at McDonald's.  See my customer images.As far as chewy and gooey, I would call them more like soggy.  These arrived when the outside temps were about 90 degrees, so I expected them to be really gooey.  The "fudge" was a not-too-sweet and not-too-flavorful layer of filling in the middle which simply tears apart.  See my customer image.  They seem to be rather crumbly and mostly held together by their oiliness.Finally, a serving size is a laughable 2 cookies.  These are so tiny, I easily ate four of them which is two servings at 150 calories an 7 grams of fat each serving.  Overall, the taste is not bad, but it is not great either.  For a rather unsatisfying 300 calories and 22% of the USRDA of fat intake, I could definitely do better.I hope you found my review and customer images useful.

I love cookies.  Let's be honest, I love all baked goods.  Chips ! has never disappointed.  Sure, some of their cookies are not not amazing, but they never made me go "ugh!"  That is, until now.These are absolutely disgusting.  The "soft" cookies are almost more along the lines of mush and the filling doesn't taste like chocolate, rather, it leaves a gross plastic taste in your mouth.  I am incredibly surprised by this considering how fantastic these sounded and excited I was to try them.And at 75 calories for every cookie that is just slightly bigger than a half dollar, this isn't worth your while on a whole other level.Save your money, do NOT buy these.

I would not buy these again.PROS:-Packaging: Open/reClose works well.-Flavor: Chocolate seems good.CONS:-Packaging: all cookies stuck together in stacks.-Flavor: No butter flavor, flour-flavor is noticeable.-Texture: Chewiness is a bit grainy.
The cookies are a chocolate lovers dream as they are filled with soft, ooey, gooey chocolatey goodness. For chocolate lovers you will love this cookie.Recommend.

These cookies were the same shape and size as the regular crisp Chips ! cookies, but they were soft with a chocolate filling. The taste was almost exactly that of regular Chips !, which I really liked, but I have to admit the filling didn't really do it for me. I wanted it to be more dense and fudge-like, but instead it was really soft, like frosting, and took up too much of the cookie. The texture of the cookie was just a little too gooey in itself, I prefer something a little more grainy in a soft cookie.These weren't bad, but I guess I like the texture of a good cookie more than I like filling, so I would probably pass on these and get the standard Chips ! instead. I didn't hate them and I didn't love them. I can't see myself craving them.If you like frosting or soft filling in your baked goods, though, you might want to try these, because the taste was good and very reminiscent of a regular Chips ! cookie  I also liked the resealable package.

These cookies are so tasty! When I got them they were a little melted from shipping in the hot sun, so I put them in the fridge. When I pulled them out and ate them cold they were really great. I have a HUGE sweet tooth and I was pleasantly surprised to find out that these cookies were enough to satisfy it. My only complaint is that I expected the fudge in the center of the cookies to be more liquidy because of the packaging which says 'chewy gooey' but they were still delicious and I would purchase them again. I received both this flavor and the megafudge. They were both great, but I prefer the chocofudge better.

Its hard to improve on a classic, but Chips  does it well. These cookies are scrumptious, i had to bring them into work before i ate them all. They are a little difficult to dunk in milk as they are so soft and not to absorbant, but it is doable.. Again very tasty and definatly a good buy!

I was not particularly impressed by these new fudge-filled chocolate chip cookies. I'm a chocolate-chip-cookie lover, but these just didn't hit the spot. There was almost no "cookie" left after they put in all the fudge. The dough that was left was a darker-than-normal brown, was crumbly, and seemed to be infused with the fudge. In all, they didn't taste much like chocolate chip cookies, though the fudge flavor is pretty good; and they were very rich. Also a warning, the cookies are quite small, but packed with saturated fat (4.5gms/18%dv in two cookies, though that's not that out of line with other chocolate chip cookies, either store-bought or home-made). So in all I'd say, not bad. But if you do go for them, go one at a time.

The resealable package is very nice, unlike their elvish competition.Upon first opening the package, the Chips  Chewy Gooey cookies didn't look that appealing compared to the photos on the package.  The cookies are soft, dark, and small, only about 2 inches across.  Because they are filled with chocolate, they can get crumbly and therefore might break apart during shipping.  Photo uploaded.  I think they could make the package smaller and contain these type of cookies better.They taste good but very rich, one or two at a time is enough for me.  Which is good because 2 of these cookies have 18% of your daily saturated fat allowance and 13g of sugar.  I would recommend these for an occasional chocolate cookie fix, but enjoy in moderation.

If you like Chips  products, they don't disappoint with these cookies. They are truly sinful. The best way I can describe it... a chocolate kiss wrapped in a chocolate chip cookie. They are rich, but oh so good! If you like chocolate and you like chocolate chip cookies....it's a match made in heaven. Enjoy!

Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge cookies have a really rich chocolate taste. Because of this intense taste of chocolate, one is best advised to not eat more than one or two at a time and have a beverage at hand (milk or cup of coffee if you prefer) to quickly wash away the powerful fudgey-chocolate flavor of the cookies. The cookies are soft in texture and are quite easy to chew. This is not a product I'd probably buy with my own money as I prefer the harder, crunchier, Chips , but if you're a fan of a soft cookie that packs a lot of flavor into a relatively compact cookie than the Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge cookies are worth taking a chance on.

Received a nice box of cookies ( total 18 cookies per box) packaged in plastic trays to help prevent breakage All cookies arrived intact and even in the brutal heat of Florida 92 deg. soft but not melted..Cookies were not crisp and filling was not gooey.. more like they had taken a  pat of chocolate and formed the cookie around it. If fact there was a slight crunch to the CHOCOLATE FILLING but not the cookie.  the cookie portion was very thin top and bottom with a few choc. chips scattered around.Now this is not a bad packaged cookie but certainly nothing to write home about. Just the regular  chips  cookie with a fudge patch in the middle. The over all taste is sweet and the usual fake chocolate flavors all store packaged cookies provide. This cookie has a rather odd aftertaste, as well.Again no kid would turn their nose up to these cookies but the average adult may take a pass.. Not worth the calories  = 2 cookies for 150 calories and 60 gm of fat.Not a repurchase for this house.. Sorry...

These delightful little cookies are about 2 inches across, with tiny chocolate chips on top and a layer of chocolate fudge within.  The fudge layer is about 1/8 inch thick.  The cookies are soft and chewy and they are sweet, chocolaty and full of favor.  They are perfect with the morning cup of coffee.  They come in a handy easy-open and resealable bag with the cookies sitting in a plastic tray, which makes them easy to store and easily accessible, even to a child.  I will pick up a couple bags on my next grocery-shopping trip.  I like them.

I've tried both the Megafudge and Chocofudge versions of these cookies, and I'm writing a similar review for both.Overall, I enjoyed the taste of these cookies. The center chocolate fudge (which is soft enough to bite through easily, but not actually gooey) is quite tasty and the highlight of the cookie to me. Chips did a good job on that part. The cakey portion of the cookies taste pretty good to me, too, but the texture isn't great. They are kind of dry and just crumble apart. So, not hard and crunchy, nor moist and soft. More like dry and soft. If you're like me, you're definitely going to want something to drink afterwards.I've tried the cookies at room temperature, warmed up in the microwave, and chilled in the refrigerator. I like them chilled the best because the cookies didn't crumble apart in my mouth like they did otherwise. Warmed up in the microwave, it wasn't much softer than room temperature...just harder to eat with some parts being uncomfortably hot. Perhaps warmed in the oven would be better, but I haven't been inspired enough to heat up Chips cookies in the oven, yet. :)These things are bite sized and have 75 calories and 3.5g of fat each. Not horrible for a cookie, for sure, but the taste isn't good enough to get me to pick these over something else.Given that the chocolate "fudge" is the main attraction to me, I liked the Megafudge version with the chocolate exterior better than the Chocofudge version because the chocolate flavor was much stronger. Both are around 3.5 stars to me, but with the edge to Megafudge, I gave them a 4 and the Chocofudge a 3 here on Amazon.I'd definitely suggest getting a single bag at the local store to try these out before buying in bulk. You might love these, but four bags is a whole lot of cookies if you don't. ;)

Length:: 1:41 MinsI do not buy too many pre-packaged cookies and when I do it's usually OREO's or fig newtons. This new cookie from Nabisco, the Chewy Gooey Chocofudge sounded promising and looked pretty good on the package but the reality was a little different.The cookie is very soft. Soft and crumbly in fact. It is so soft that it literally breaks in to little pieces as soon as I pick it up and begin to eat it. I guess that's a good reason to pop the entire cookie into the mouth in one bite, since they are small enough to do just that. The "representation" of the cookie on the package shows the cookie much larger than it really is and as you can see by my video, the real cookied bears little resemblance to the picture of the cookie.As for taste and mouth feel... I did not care for it at all.At best, this is a barely OK pre-packaged cookie. However I would not buy these again. I'm being generous with a 2-star rating. My wife took one bite and threw the rest of it away. The chocolately taste was the only reason I gave it more than two stars.

When got this product, I was looking forward to a real taste treat.  A nice soft cookie with a gooey fudge center, what could go wrong?  When I tried these cookies, I have to say that I was far from impressed.When I received my package of cookies, it was a hot day and the package had been sitting outside for awhile.  I opened the pack of cookies right away and took a bite.  The fudge was gooey all right.  It might have been a decent cookie except for the fact the cookie part crumbled in my hand with the first bite.  This led to my hands getting covered in gooey fudge that made quite a mess.  All I can say is I am glad my 3 young kids didn't get into the cookies first.I left the cookies inside in the air conditioning for a few hours and decided to have one after dinner.  Much to my surprise, the fudge drastically changed texture.  It was no longer gooey, but now it was more of a spongy, solid texture.  There was still some "gooeyness" to them, but nothing like what it shows on the package.When it comes to taste, the only analogy I can think of is with chocolate.  You know those chocolates that come out on every holiday that people buy for the kids that is real cheap chocolate?  The chocolate is cheap, gritty, and kind of has an unnatural taste to it.  These cookies are kind of like that.  The cookie is not bad, but for some reason the taste just does not work.  The only thing that pops into my mind is that cheap chocolate.  The taste just does not seem right.  It did not taste like a decent chocolaty treat, they tasted artificial and cheap.  In my opinion, when the cookies were warm when I first tried them, they tasted better than when they were room temperature.  In the case of my family, these cookies got pushed to the back of the pantry and not even half a pack was eaten before they got tossed.I think the idea of product was great, but I think the execution was poor (kind of like the McDonald's McDLT for those who remember them, the sandwich where the hot side stayed hot, the cold side stayed cold, you put them together and you get a lukewarm sandwich).  The cookie was way too soft and crumbly, the fudge was not very gooey at room temperature, and the product did not have a good chocolaty flavor to it.  At the very least, a cookie that stayed together and did not make a mess would be a huge improvement.If you are a chocoholic, this product might be worth a try.  If you are looking for a sweet treat to savor the taste of, then I would definitely recommend steering clear of this cookie.

It is incredibly difficult for a huge company or even ANY company or even most bakeries to make a chocolate chip cookie that tastes homemade.  Apparently chocolate chip cookies are one of the hardest to duplicate.  While I did not expect this to taste like homemade,  I expected just a bit more out of this cookie especially with this flavor.  I love the regular chocolate chip cookies from this company so I thought I would love these also.This product certainly delivers what it claims with the fudge stuffed aspect. It is rich and fudgy, with a yummy creamy center and nice bits of chocolate pieces,  but the cookie surrounding the fudge is too chemical tasting for me.  If you  want the option of having a fudge stuffed cookie then stick to the  Megafudge style.

When asked to try these, my daughter said "delicious".  Asked for more information she added that they are soft.  She would have expected cookies that come in this kind of package to be crunchy but these were surprisingly soft.  She also said they are very chocolaty, and when asked to give them a rating out of 5, she chose the 5.  So since they get the thumbs up approval of a teenage girl (not easy), I guess we'll be ordering them again.

When I think of chocolate chip cookies two brands come to mind, Toll House and Chips .  Now Chips  has been around for quite some time and over the years they have come out with many variations of their cookies, from the classic style to cookies with nuts, oatmeal, reduced fat and candy bits, just to list a few.This deviation is "chewy gooey chocofudge" which is a soft style cookie with a fudge center.  So to simplify even further, there is a soft/chewy chocolate chip cookie surrounding a fudgy center.  I would have thought I would have liked this cookie more than I did.  I mean a chocolate chip cookie with a fudge center, how could that be bad? Allow me to explain....I think that the combination of chewy cookie and fudge is too much.  I almost wished the cookie was traditional; it would balance the fudge better.  The fudge itself is almost more like cake icing, very concentrated.  Not to mention that all the fudge took away from the chocolate chips.  The final issue, perhaps the most unnerving, is there is a bizarre aftertaste.  It is almost like I can taste the preservatives in this product.  If a person is a hard core chocolate junkie I think this product is a grand slam.  I prefer the old school Chips  chocolate chip cookie. However, capitalism will tell if this "spin" on a classic will stay on the shelves or not.  Who knows, perhaps we will see chocolate covered chocolate chip cookies next.

These super moist chocolate chip cookies come with a layer of fudge inside of them. If you are looking for a lot of chocolate, these cookies are for you.But they are not as great as they are at first taste. After a couple of bites, the cookie part tastes a little bland, almost like they used too much flour in the cookie. When you bite into them, the cookie around the fudge stays semi firm but on the edges crumbles away. Also, they are really small cookies, about the size of a silver dollar. I was a little shocked at how few cookies were in the large package.And, of course, if you are looking for a quick chocolate treat, two cookies are 150 calories. If you want a good chocolate snack look elsewhere.Shawn KovacichCreator of numerous books and DVDs.

I am a big fan of chocolate and chocolate chip cookies, so I am somewhat partial to these gooey cookies. They are filled with chocolate fudge, which makes them noticeably sweeter than most other chocolate chip cookies. They are certainly very gooey, but they are not at all chewy. They are also much smaller than most other Chips ! chocolate chip cookies. They are very crumbly, and I am even tempted to leave them in the fridge to stiffen up. Like most other Chips ! packagings, the box has an easy resalable cover which will help keep the cookies fresh for as long as they last. Overall, these are good chocolate-chips cookies that add a new twist to this kind of sweets.

I wish I could give these cookies ten stars! I am not generally a fan of pre-packaged cookies, but these are as moist as homemade. The chocolate filling has the same flavor and consistancy as chocolate chips in cookies still warm from the oven. It is not gooey, nor is it overly sweet. And, there is exactly the right amount to enhance, rather than overpower, the taste of the cookie. Well done, Chips ! Very well done!

I can't give any higher recommendation than to say that when the mail came and this package of Chips  was opened in front of 2 adults and 2 children....the package was eaten in MINUTES!They were especially tasty when heated for 10 seconds in the microwave!  Gooey goodness!Would I buy them again?  Sure!  They were scrumptious.  However, if you want a package of cookies to LAST in the house...you best stick to something with a little less taste!Enjoy!

I was under the impression that everything that could possibly be done to a cookie has already been done. There have been cookies dipped in chocolate, covered in sprinkles, or with frosting on top. That is why I wanted to try these new cookies because I am always interested in a "new" take on the old classic chocolate chip cookie. Most "new and improved" cookies fail but Chips  has done it right this time!! These cookies are a wonderful new twist on the fantastic classic chocolate chip cookie. These cookies are just like regular Chips , which I love, but a bit gooey-er. They almost taste like they're just out of the oven. The best part, is that they have chocolate INSIDE the cookies. I don't want to say that they're "stuffed" because that would sound like the chocolate inside is overpowering...which it is not. Instead, there's a thin layer of chocolate in the middle that is just perfect and makes the cookies a real treat! If you warm them up a bit in the microwave or oven, the inside gets extra gooey and fudgey which I love! Basically, this is the perfect dessert. I felt completely satisfied after eating two cookies and with a good-sized helping in the package, I have more than enough for the next two weeks. I know that new takes on a tried and true classic can be a letdown, but trust me on this one...it won't disappoint!

You are going to need it with these! Hopefully you will savor them, unlike myself. I ate the whole stinkin package!! Talk about yum. Chips  are delicious anyway, I was just craving them the other day, so these came at the perfect time. The fudge in the middle, holy guacamole!!! Just added another dimension to already yummy, soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies! Now I have to go soon and get another package, or TWO!!

These cookies arrived on the first day of summer during a heatwave.  I expected they would be melted beyond all recognition and was quite surprised to open the package (which is cleverly resealable)  and find the entire contents intact.  Right away I wondered just how gooey and chewy they would be if 105 degree temps and a day in the mail truck couldn't melt them.Well, it turns out they were definitely chewy but not what I would call gooey!  I found these cookies to be pretty sweet, more so than "chocolatey" and that was a big disappointment.  I would have to say that regular old 'Toll House' type cookies are much better in both the chocolate and chewy category.  I also was struck by how 'processed' they seemed to taste.  More so than many of the packaged cookies we purchase. IN fact, for me there seemed to be some unidentifiable taste (not a bad taste) that didn't jibe with the ingredients.  Nothing terrible, just not what I was expecting.I admit my taste buds aren't what they used to be, but these are my honest observations.  I am quite sure these cookies will turn out to be many people's favorites so please don't take offense.  For me, I think I will stick with my standby toll house mix in a bag.  Yeah, you gotta bake em, but they are immeasurable better in every way!  Nice try Chips , but no cigar from this household.

I had actually had one or two of these cookies at a picnic a few weeks back. I was fairly impressed at how good they were and was eager to try them again.  Unfortunately, the pack that I received from Amazon was less than impressive. The cookies themselves were dark, seemingly burned. Half of the pack was broken. And honestly, they just didn't live up to my memory of just a few weeks earlier. I'd be willing to give the cookies one more swing, based on my first exposure.  Because, to be certain, if this pack of Chips  Gooey were my first go round...  there wouldn't be a second.

These are really tasty cookies, but the name isn't quite right. They say they're chewy and gooey. They're neither. The outside is more "crumbly" than "chewy", and the inside is definitely not gooey; It's more like a big chocolate chip.They might be gooey if you microwaved them for a few seconds, I suppose.They are so crumbly, in fact, that the contents of my package were pretty beat-up by the time I got it. Cookies were broken in half, or shattered into crumbs.Still, the flavor is awesome and that's what really counts here. I'd say get them if you're a chocolate lover.

This cookies are simply delicious.  They are soft and chewy and will satisfy any sweet tooth.  The center has enough fudge to satisfy your taste buds, but doesn't overwhelm you. However, if you don't have a sweet tooth, you will need a cup of milk to go with this treat. My family loved them.  They can improve the resealable tab.  It didn't work well- at least on the package I received.

Not really impressed by these cookies. They are too sweet for me, and don't have much chocolate or fudge flavor. Also, they are more soft and gooey than chewy. Maybe they're OK as a kids desert, but I think adults will want something with more flavor.

Since it's summer and extremely hot outside, I expected these cookies to be very nearly melted when I opened the package.  But they were still perfectly intact.  And were not actually gooey at all.  The chocolate filling in them is soft and a little grainy as cooked chocolate tends to be.What I do love about these cookies is that the chocolate inside is dark chocolate.  In my experience, chocolate chip cookie fans like milk chocolate in their cookies.  I tend to prefer oatmeal and dark chocolate in my cookies--trick myself into feeling like it's a healthy cookie--but in most cookie crowds, my preference seems to be in the minority.  I am so glad the good people at Chips  see things the way I do.  Well, no oatmeal in there, but it is dark chocolate.They don't taste like fresh-baked cookies.  They are soft and moist, which is good, but they do taste packaged and preserved.  I guess that's not so shocking considering that they are actually packaged and preserved.  The cookies are small... I don't see a problem with that... as they are soft cookies; their size keeps them from crumbling under their own weight.I asked my 8-yr-old daughter to "review" these cookies.  I did use the word "review."  She said, "They taste like cookies.  With extra chocolate."  Then, feeling that a review should probably be more creative, she announced, "It's like there are stars bursting in my mouth!!"  Yes, creative, but I have no idea what that is really supposed to mean.  Means she likes them I guess.

Chocolate chip cookies with a chocolate center? What a concept! Good thing someone finally made it real. Chewy Gooey Chocofudge is a treat which delivers what it promises, but not so much the "gooey" part.The texture of the cookie is like the soft Nutri-Grain Cereal Bars, Strawberry, 8-Count Bars (Pack of 6), but that's where the similarities end. The chocolate center isn't gooey though, but it is a healthy dose of chocolate. Still disappointing for people who were expecting cascades of chocolate. I have a serious sweet tooth, and I found the aftertaste to be too sweet for me. They are still very enjoyable, just keep that milk within reach.Serious chocoholics will enjoy them.

What could be better than a soft Chips  cookie with a fudge center?  Apparently quite a few things, as this tempting snack did not live up to expectations.  To start with, the image of the cookie on the package looked nothing like the contents within.  Perhaps it was because the cookies arrived on my doorstep in the heat of summertime, I don't know, but what I found were trays of unappealing, blackened-looking (because of the fudge interior) chocolate chip cookies.  Oddly, it looked as if these snacks got into a fight and emerged all black and bruised.Still, a cookie might look ugly and still offer up a great taste.  Well, not so much.  Yes, there was a definite overload of chocolate, to be sure, but it had a sandy, gritty taste.  I stopped my snacking after a single cookie, even though the serving size is two for 3.5 grams of saturated fat (thankfully, no trans fat).  Again, I am willing to accept that I maybe got a bad package or one effected by the heat, though I rescued it from my porch less than ten minutes after it was dropped off by UPS.  I can't recommend this, unfortunately.  I would instead go with a Keebler Soft Batch cookie any day.

These are pretty good for Chips  and have a good flavor.  The chocolate is a bit strong in the cookie (you feel that you need to drink something to overcome the flavor).  They are good, and enjoyable.  The Gooey center is not as gooey as the picture would have you think.  In fact I feel that they have a chippy (or hardened chocolate) when you bite into them.They are good, and if you give them a try you will either love them or hate them.  However, keep in mind, the different taste seems weird at first, but after a couple of cookies they are really good.In the end they are good cookies, and offer a different twist on the chips  that we all love.  Also they ship well.  I live in South Georgia and even after being in a mailbox for a whole day, they were not melted.  They held their shape and texture, and were very good (even after being in a mailbox in 100+ degrees weather!

This is a pleasant new addition to the Chips ! brand.  It's softer and a little smaller than the original chocolate chip cookie. Each cookie has a bit of fudge flavored choco-cream in the center.  Although it's soft, it holds up surprisingly well when repeatedly dipped in milk.I scanned the package looking for any mention of hydrogenated oil, but happily found no such listing.10 oz was actually plenty to satisfy a couple of sweet-toothed kids (and mom).  It was a rare indulgence.  It certainly doesn't taste homemade, but will satisfy on a road trip any day...

I received the package and was surprised that more than half of the cookies in the package were broken.  I ordered this as an office treat, and hardly anyone ate them.  They just looked said, all broken in there with no real chunks to grab and enjoy.These aren't that gooey, either.  I prefer the chewy Chips !, as at least they're intact.  These cookies tasted a little more dry than the chewy ones, and I didn't notice any larger chip chunks or "gooiness," per se.

The Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge along with their cousins, the Chips ! Chewy Gooey Megafudge, 10-Ounce (Pack of 4) have been a disappointment. There is something off with the taste. It tastes flat and overprocessed, and on top of that each cookie is 75 calories. These are fairly small cookies, around 2 inches in diameter.Too bad because the description sounded promising. These Chocofudge actually taste slightly better than the Megafudge, perhaps because they have less of the uninspiring fudgeness.They arrive in a package that opens and reseals at the top. The cookies are arranged in three rows of six cookies each.They get 2.5 stars for the taste, but 75 calories for a 2-inch cookie drops them down to 2 stars.If I had to chose between these Chewy Gooey and the regular Chips cookies, I would definitely go with the regular tried and true Chips s.

My kids ate the whole package!  My ten year old says, "They were good!  They reminded me of a melted Hershey bar." She also would also recommend them to her friends, she says, because they were that good.  They were chewy and gooey and best chocolate chip cookies she says she ever had.I liked:  That they were divided into three stacks side ways.  There was 10 oz in the package, so it did seem there were less cookies than other packages.  However, the kids really loved these and there weren't any left over for anyone else to taste test by the time they were done snacking.  I think this would be a great snack for a chocoholic.

This treat was tested by myself (mom/wife), my husband, and our 7 year old son. It is a very gooey chocolate chip cookie, with much chocolate goo on the inside.  I truly only like cookies that reach that certain perfect consistency when submerged in milk.  This cookie never reached that point. It stayed gooey and soft.  In fact, even when I tried to pick the cookies up from the container, then bent and broke apart.My husband commented that he enjoyed the cup of milk more than the cookies.Our 7 year old said that it was good, but he would choose the original Chips  over this gooey version.We all agreed that your money would be better spent, and taste buds more thoroughly satisfied, if you stick with the very delicious original Chips .

I love chocolate, and I love cookies, so I was excited to try these cookies.  I was particularly looking forward to a gooey center filled with fudge, as depicted by the large picture on the package.  I was disappointed.  There is a thin, disc-shaped chocolate-colored center in these cookies, but it is certainly not gooey.  Really, it's more like putty, and it doesn't have any discernable chocolate flavor.  The rest of the cookie is chalky in texture and also has no recognizable chocolate flavor.  Personally, I prefer the regular, old fashioned Chips  cookies over this new gooey version.

If you've already committed yourself to eating some store bought cookies, these are probably the ones you want. They are soft and gooey. That, to me, pretty much defines a good chocolate chip cookie. The softer and gooier the better. Now, I don't even want to think about what chemicals they are using to create a cookie that stays soft and gooey for months. And I don't want to think about all that sugar either. Just give me my cookie and my big glass of milk. Chips , laddy!

What I like about these cookies is how soft they are.  Most packaged cookies are hard, and you don't get that softness you get from a cookie right after you bake it.They are chock full of chocolate, but they are not as sweet as I feared they might be. I think most adults would want a better tasting chocolate for their palette, though, and a little less of that artificial sweetness.I think most kids would love them, and they are small, which makes for a nice treat size. They are not gooey when you break them open, though, as the picture on the packaging implies.

OK, these are my new favorite Chips  cookies! The usual nice taste, but with a surprise in the middle: chocolate gooey stuff! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge Chips  cookies are definitively chewy and there is is real gooey stuff inside! My kids' only complaint was that the package should hold more cookies! The resealable package is easy to open and reseals very well.

These cookies taste fresh and sugary sweet, with `gooey' chocolate chips, and a `chewy,' but cake-like cookie dough texture.  There is a firm flavor of vanilla in these cookies, making for a nice contrast with the fudge flavor of the chocolate chips.  At 150 calories for two cookies, you'll want to pace yourself, or alternatively, buy lots of bags of these bad buys.  They taste great with a glass of milk as an afternoon snack.  They also taste great with a glass of milk as a morning snack.  As an evening snack...

Chips !'s latest entry into the competitive chocolate chip market is "Chewy Gooey Chocofudge". The package comes with a convenient re-sealing top, to keep your cookies fresh. Which brings me to the cookies themselves - while they taste pretty good, they are definitely not what I clarify as "gooey". Think of these cookies as having a chocolate fudge inside, with the veneer of a regular chocolate chip cookie on the outside. The cookies are easy to bite into.Size-wise, the cookies are more bite-sized (3/4 of an inch or less) than regular size. They don't look as appealing as the outer package photo. If you can live with that, these are pretty decent cookies to snack on.My recommendation: put the cookies on a baking pan or microwave and heat them up before serving. They go well with a cold glass of milk, which is really the only way to eat chocolate chip cookies anyway.

I put these in my fridge for one day before I even opened it. When I did finally open it, contents had definitely shifted during shipping, since the inside of the package would lead one to believe it had been thrown down a flight of stairs. I know shipping is a separate issue -- unrelated to the quality of the product, but I would be hestitant to buy cookies online unless something were done about the packaging. Despite the cookies being busted, I enjoyed them being cold & hard, as opposed to being advertised as soft & gooey -- I think if these cookies were served room temprature, parents would have fun cleaning up chocolate covered kids. In any case, the Chewy Gooey Chocofudge is a yummy new item from Chips !!

I have never been much of a fan of Chips ! chocolate chip cookies.  I don't like hard chocolate chip cookies and I would only eat a Chips ! if I was stuck at a kid's party or some other place where there was nothing better.  Now, though, Chips ! has launched two new soft chocolate chip cookies:  the one under review here (Chocofudge) and Megafudge.  I think they are both pretty good, but I think the Chocofudge is better.  The Megafudge is almost like a brownie -- as many fudge-style cookies are -- and I prefer a more conventional cookie.  So, if you are thinking of trying one of these Chips ! cookies, you shouldn't be too disappointed with either one, but I would go with the Chocofudge.  Actually, of the mass produced chocolate chip cookies, I prefer the Pepperidge Farms soft baked Nantucket chocolate chip cookie.

These were pretty good. Not great, but pretty good. The texture was good, as far as soft cookies go. They were soft, but still held together in the package and when you removed them from the package. The flavor was stronger and more chocolatey than the "megafudge"  version of this cookie, which I also sampled. They were not gooey, in spite of the name of the cookie, but I see that as a benefit.The cookies come in the resealable package, which works very well and I like.I probably would not buy these cookies in the store, but did like them well enough to eat several for dessert on the day I opened up the package.

I absolutely adore chocolate chip cookies, especially soft ones with lots of opportunities to nibble.  These new Chips  cookies are so yummy!  They're soft, with lots of chocolate chips and a fun, fudgy center.  When I got a box, I immediately opened it and doled out portions for the family into separate plastic bags, because I knew I'd be tempted to each everyone else's share!  My share quickly disappeared, and I am now poised to go do a long, cardio-heavy workout to burn off all this sugar and fat.  As much as I love these cookies, they're NOT for every day, and especially not if you want to slim down!If you do purchase these through Amazon, I would recommend putting them in the fridge if they've been exposed to high temperatures, such as in the summer while they're out in the USPS delivery truck.  I can imagine the center fudge could easily melt and create a big mess.  Time in the fridge would solidify these right up.My only criticism would be with the price-- it seems a little high for only 18 cookies.  A family of four would go through a box in no time flat, for sure.But overall-- tastes great, don't have it every day, and be sure to burn off the calories!

I was disappointed by these cookies, and would never get them again.  Here's what went wrong.1. The cookies themselves are not "engineered" to withstand any kind of travel or transport.  Upon opening the package, over 60% of the cookies were broken, with piles of crumbs at the bottom of each tray well.  Those cookies that were spared would practically disintegrate when I picked them up.  This made for difficult eating.2. The cookies have a very strange chemical flavor to them that I couldn't explain.  it's most noticeable in the aftertaste, but both my wife and I found it extremely unappealing.  They're also far sweeter than normal chips ! cookies.3. The cookies are small.  Meaning, if you want to feel like you really satisfied your sweet tooth, you'll have to eat far more than the recommended serving size of ...two cookies (150 cal, 7g fat, 3.5 sat. fat, 13g sugar). If you can get past the aftertaste, you'll want at least 4 to feel satisfied.

These are smaller than the average Chips  Chocolate Chip Cookie.  They are very soft and chewy, but not too chewy that your jaw tires before you can swallow!  I wouldn't say they're gooey, but they are "mushier" than a soft chocolate chip cookie.  They are VERY sweet.  Too sweet for me, and I am a major chocoholic with a sweet tooth!  They seem to have a lot of brown sugar in them as that's the most prominent taste.  The chocolate center isn't really fudgey either -- it's more like a Hershey's kiss in the center.  Kids will probably love these (my son likes them), but I'd never give them more than one or two in a day!  Honestly, I prefer the original Chips  over these and probably wouldn't reach for these again (unless my son asked me to buy them)

The cookie is basically a single "center" piece of chocolate with a thin cookie coating plus chocolate chips. The idea, is you heat them up and they become this big chocolate gooey-ness of delight.Well, yes and no.We get the same re-sealable packaging and 150 calories per serving (2 cookies. . .they are small)Also, I'm normally very critical about food products these days since we have the a lot of options to make things healthier. In this case we have flour, sugar, cornstarch, more sugar, cocoa button, etc. Overall, other than the preservatives that keep the cookies "fresh" I was impressed. . .but I still don't like them very much.I've always been of the opinion that processed/packaged cookies that say "chewy" never taste like real, soft cookies. And this continues that trend. . .it just doesn't taste real.I'm more of a processed cookie needs to be non-chewy or if you want chewy make homemade.Kids are definitely not particular, they just want a sweet item. My kids did like them, but agree that homemade cookies will always win out. Even with all their praise, they didn't come chase me down the following day for more cookies, they wanted other sweets. So, it was a fleeting impression on them too.Go with the original in my opinion, you could pass on these unless you really want something you don't have to cook and isn't a hard cookie cookie.

These cookies are great if you also love Chewy Chips  cookies. The extra heavy layer of fudge in the middle it too much for some, but for others in our family it was just right.That said; some of us feel that Chips  original cookies are the one and only. For us this cookie offers very little. They are not the cookie for those looking for that crisp crunchy perfectly balanced chocolate chip cookie that is the original Chips .Simple math: Love Chewy Chips  = Like or Love these cookies / Love original Chips  = Not likely to love these cookies.

While I love Chips  cookies, I can't say these "Chewy Gooey Chocofudge" cookies would ever win me over. They are slightly reminiscent of the Chewy Chips  cookies, but filled with fudge in the middle. If you like the chewy CA cookies, you'll like this. If you're on the fence about the chewy version (like me), then this definitely will not sway you to their side. Oh man, these are bad. I've tried eating a couple of them at different times of the day just to give my taste buds a chance to try a second opinion, but it's always pretty much the same. Think I'll go back to my old favorites, the original brand.

Small cookie with chocolate chips and gooey chocolate in the middle. It was soft and chewy which I like. Overall it was a little too sweet for me. As my teenager said after eating one "eh" Not bad, but not great,

First: I wanted to like these cookies.  I really did.  The concept is good, they look awesome on the outside of the package.  I like the regular chewy Chips  (like them, not love them) so I figured the addition of more chocolate would be a plus.Before opening the package, I checked the ingredients.  To my VERY pleasant surprise, no HFCS, but real sugar.  Doesn't say cane or beet, so I'll probably never know, but it isn't HFCS.  I'm sensitive to HFCS, so this was a BIG positive for me - and the only reason the cookies got two stars instead of one.Now for the bad:  The cookies are small.  A little smaller than standard crispy Chips .  That's not a bad thing, except a serving is two cookies and that serving comes to 150 calories.  For the calorie content of approximately 3 cookies, I could've had a Snickers bar (or similar) - and I would have been happier.Finally, to touch on the title of my review: I hope I got a bad batch.  These cookies were awful. They tasted like plastic.  I'm not talking about a plastic texture, but taste.  They honestly tasted like melting/burnt plastic.  My wife tried one and noticed the same thing (without any coaching from me).  I'd love to try another batch, in hopes of having received defective cookies, but I'm not going to take the chance.If you're considering buying a pre-packaged cookie, stick with the standard Chips  varieties - crispy or chewy.  But stay away from these.

Words cannot describe the nasty aftertaste in my mouth right now after just having finished one of these cookies. I am currently wracking my brain thinking what I have in the house that might get rid of this taste (other than brushing my teeth). Ugh. Basically, these are the regular soft Chips  cookies with a chocolate filling. It's not a gooey filling that spreads out of the cookie when broken open like the picture on the package implies. The filling just sticks inside the cookie and stays there when you break it in half. Not gooey at all (though I'm not even sure that would have helped). The flavor is totally artificial and sickeningly sweet with, as I have already mentioned, a very nasty aftertaste that lingers. My husband had pretty much the same response as I did when he tried the cookies. My 12 yr. old kids are away for a few weeks, but when they get home I'm going to let them try them and see what they say. Personally, I would stay far, far away from these.

The soft cookies are oddly flavorless, with a chemicalish undertone.  The filling is an OK texture (though not particularly gooey) and proportion, but not particularly tasty.  They weren't even very good dipped in milk.  I ate them, but I'm not sure why...I think it was just because they were there.  I wouldn't get them again, but a die-hard Chips  fan might like them alright.

As a big fan of Chips  chocolate chip cookies, both the original and the chewy, I was prepared to love these as well. But it was just a big glob of mushy chocolate, barely held together with a tiny bit of cookie. Now, like most people, I'm pretty enthusiastic about chocolate, and theoretically, there is simply no such thing as "too much." But it just didn't taste right here. I really wish there had been more cookie involved, to break up the taste a bit; maybe that would've helped. But whatever went wrong here, it definitely did.Overall, it was a rather disappointing experience. I won't be buying these anytime soon.

I normally eat cookies from bakeries, rather than supermarket cookies, as  provided by my workplace at lunches and events, so I'm comparing them with what I'm familiar with, not against other industrially produced cookies.These are very sweet, without much real chocolate flavor.  While the gooey chocolate filling is much better than just the dry little chips, it needed to have more flavor. The texture of the cookie itself was what really lost me.  Instead of being soft and chewy, it had a sandy, gritty quality.  I'll stick with just the bakery cookies.

Adding extra chocolate to something already chocolaty is usually a spectacular idea. Unfortunately, the end result of adding a gooey, fudge center to Chewy Chips ! cookies is something that looks like a mushy cookie and tastes like a mouthful of chemicals.The taste of these cookies is strange. They look and smell like your average Chewy Chips ! if left out in the sun for a bit. The appearance doesn't do anything to indicate the taste though. The initial bite is of a salty, sweet cookie, but there is a biting aftertaste that points to way too much in the way of processing and preservatives.The fudge used to fill these cookies isn't gooey. The picture on the package in no way accurately represents the consistency of the filling. The fudge is thicker and drier than expected and doesn't seem to have any flavor at all.Chocofudge Chips ! are a disappointment. A better choice would be to just stick with the original Chewy Chips ! cookies.

This rating is as much for the state of delivery as the cookies themselves.  The cookies were delivered in a box with air pillows but were totally crunched.  Because they are "gooey," you'd think crunched meant just smooshed, but, no, actually crumbly as well. There wasn't a whole cookie in the package.Still, being a fan of the normal chewy Chips , I figured my cookie crumbs would at least be tasty.  The taste is different, though, more bitter and almost metallic.Maybe there was a chemical reaction going on here, exposure to higher humidity or air that caused the crumbs, thus impacting the taste, too.  Regardless, these were literally dead on arrival.I love amazon.com, but cookies and crackers seem to be total waste of money purchases.  I don't know if the fault rests with UPS, but cookies and crackers are the only amazon shipping fails I've experienced in 10 years.

Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge is very soft and chewy as advertised.  I found the chocolate filling inside a little overpowering though.  The cookie was smaller than the average chocolate chip cookie, but a little thicker.  I really liked the way the package opened and could be resealed.  It would be nice if all cookie packages were like this one.  I might have liked the cookies a little more if I could have warmed them, but the kids loved them and they disappeared too quickly for me to get the chance.  I prefer the Chips  chocolate chunk cookies, so my rating for these would be 3 stars, but the kids would rate them 5 stars.  I set my actual rating at 4 which is smack in the middle of what I thought and what the kids thought.  I think that's fair

Basically, these are very soft chocolate chip cookie with a fudge filled center. This is pretty much what is advertised, and thus there can't be any complaints on that end. However, I just don't particularly see the value in this compared to many other options -- they don't particularly taste special (average....maybe even a bit worse than that compared to more expensive options), and each cookie is pretty small. Sure you can just eat more, but I find a single larger item more satisfying than two smaller ones, especially when it there's a filling such as in here. And the fudge somewhat overwhelms the fact they are chocolate chip cookies on the outside.Three stars, on account of the fact that they ARE still good enough that, were I presented with a plate of these and no worries about health, I would still chow down -- but at the same time, I'd choose many more options first were I given a choice.

When Chips ! first came on the scene when I was young, I thought they were a good cookie that was always soft and a good balance of cookie to chocolate chip ratio. Since then, they have come up with variants on the initial blend to keep people interested and aware of the Chips ! brand line. Now they introduce Chips ! Chewey Gooey Chocofudge. Do I like it? Not really. Maybe its with age or refined taste or my lack of interest in snacks and sweet foods in my older years, but I found this cookie very sweet. Not just in the chocolate chips, but the cookie itself seemed very sugary. Also, in addition to the many chocolate chips, it looks like they baked one giant chip smack in the middle to ensure every bite gets a chocolaty taste. So it seems overkill on the sweetness factor. And because this is a cookie that is manufactured by food scientists to ensure sameness in every cookie, it ended up tasting on the artifical side. Perhaps these would taste better fresh out of an oven and have a warm taste, but that is a preference for the individul to determine. But they are not sold that way, so I am taking it as it is given. So will I buy these? No. I dont buy the ones I grew up with, so I definitely will not get these either.

Cookies are one of my four food groups, and it really pains me to give a cookie a bad rap. However, these cookies do not taste good! They smell sort of good, and they are fresh and soft. They taste awful! They do not taste like Chips  cookies or just plain old chocolate chip cookies. The soft "chocolate" filling has a very unpleasant artificial taste. The cookies do not taste like chocolate. They taste like a cheap, imitation food product. I had such high hopes : (

I love the softness of Chops ! cookies so I like to buy them often, but I'm not all that fond of this particular Chewey Gooey kind. The inside is filled with gooey chocofudge, which I like as far as texture goes, but the chocofudge is really, really rich, too rich for my taste (had to break out the milk after one bite) so I can't have more than one cookie at a time.For intense chocolate lovers, this would be just the thing, but if you're not an addict of chocolate then this'll probably be a bit much for you.

To say the actual product bears no resemblance to the gorgeous cookie on the package would be a huge understatement. The cookies are tiny and do not 'ooze chocolately goodness' as the picture indicates, although they do have something resembling a chocolate center. The cookies are tooth-achingly sweet and otherwise flavorless. The product looks interesting but the execution is very poor. I don't even have any suggestions for tweaks that would improve this -- Nabisco needs to throw this out and start over. I'm surprised it made it past what I'm sure must have been many testers and focus groups.

I am on a quest for a satisfying grocery store chocolate chip cookie. Unfortunately, Chips  Chewy Gooey didn't get me any closer to my goal. For context, I like regular Chips , but don't consider them great; I prefer a softer texture. Chewy Gooeys are not hard, but also not really soft. More mushy, or squishy. Also, the fudge filling isn't gooey, more like pasty. The overall mouth feel is too oily for my taste. Finally, I couldn't get the resealable package to open correctly and had to put the remaining cookies in another container.When I gave one to my husband telling him that I didn't care for it, he popped it in his mouth and disagreed with me saying, "I don't know, they're OK." We won't be buying any of these to stock our pantry.PS. A quick warm up in the microwave helped the texture of both the cookie and filling, but not enough to change my mind about future purchases.

These are small, soft, cake-like cookies with a fudgey center. Yes, they're chewy and gooey and boy are they sweet. A bit too sweet for my taste, but my husband, who still has the taste buds of a kid, gives them two thumbs up. Pretty good for a store-bought cookie, and a little bit of an upgrade from regular Chips .

Chips ! Chewy Gooey Chocofudge cookies are a chocolate chip cookie stuffed with soft chocolate.  They're good but they don't really take the basic chocolate chip cookie in significantly new or interesting directions.  This is nothing much more than a soft cookie with a layer of frosting on the inside. Ultimately not so exciting that they inspired much more than a shrug.  Not bad but really not a big deal.  And one of us who tried them said we'd rather just eat freshly baked cookies because these tasted a bit fake.

It isn't really chewy or gooey but if chocofudge is concoction that is neither truly chocolate of fudge then the description is one third correct.  These cookies aren't as overly sweet as many new entries on the market but the smaller size does indicate that they are pushing the limits on how much sugar and fat can be stuffed into a single serving.  While the outside isn't as crumbly as the texture and taste would predict, it seems to be little more than a coating for the center portion of semisolid fudge.  This stuff is more sugar than anything else, with a bit of texture to it and a slight chocolate flavor.  The cookie itself isn't very good although there is only enough of it to cover the fudge center. Overall, none of the parts of these cookie come together well and the result is a letdown.
I ate way too many when they first arrived.  Like most chocolate chip cookies, I can't eat just one. For my personal taste they are way too rich & I probably won't buy them again.

I like the regular Chips  cookies. They are crunchy. The outside of these Gooey gookies are crumbly like a dry cake. The inside is similar to the filling in a Keebler double stuffed fudge cookie, but the taste doesn't work well with the crummy cookie.Even a glass of cold milk couldn't save these cookies. I had another adult try one, but it went into the trash after one bite.

I couldn't resist getting a pack of these cookies to give them a try. As I opened the package the wonderful aroma of rich chocolaty cookies filled my nostrils. I picked up my first cookie and immediately noticed the soft texture and fresh feel. I was a little surprised when I gently broke open this chocolate chip cookie to expose the fudge center. The fudge center was not gooey like the picture on the packaging had suggested. The center was more like soft chocolate rather than gooey fudge. My wife decided to put one in the microwave in an attempt to make it gooey, yet that didn't work either.As for the taste, I felt the cookies tasted pretty good. I still prefer homemade chocolate chip cookies and I suppose I shouldn't expect packaged cookies to come close to homemade cookies. All in all these cookies are some of the better grocery store cookies you can buy. I recommend them, but I wish the fudge lived up to the advertising. Don't expect gooey fudge on the inside, but rather soft chocolate and you won't be disappointed.This item would get 4 stars if the fudge was actually gooey by the time it reaches consumers. I would be willing to give a perfect 5 stars if the fudge was gooey and the flavor profile tasted even more like homemade chocolate chip cookies.

(See the image gallery for my three photos that accompany this review)I hadn't eaten a Chips  in a while, but was kind of looking forward to these new "Gooey" chocolate chip cookies. But, from the moment I opened the package I knew I was going to be disappointed! First off, the cookies were a crumbled and jumbled heap of a few cookies in overly large packaging... the same as regular Chips  packaging that would hold two or three times as many cookies. Not the most appetizing first impression. So... is this really what Nabisco wants us to see when we open the package?? a jumble of cookies in an overly large package for the few cookies you get? A total turnoff from the beginning. I didn't expect the cookie to be as big as the photo on the package, but I did expect it to at least kind of look like the photo (which looks like a standard Chips  with the goo inside). This cookie was dark and mottled and misshapen and kind a gross to look at.Okay, presentation stinks, but maybe the cookies are really good nonetheless? Um... no... they kind of suck. And, Gooey?? Not even close... it is a wedge of grainy and dry chocolate-like stuff in the middle. The most distinct flavor (or really after-taste)? That is an overly sugary and heavily preserved food-like substance. After one cookie, I tossed the rest out.Bottom line... just plain gross.

These are chewy chips  cookies (not the crunchy ones), with a chocolate fudge baked into them. What could there possibly be not to like? ;-) The fudge is uniformly and well distributed throughout the cookie and it complements the cookie part well. The overall taste is very rich and very delicious. The soft chewy cookie complements the texture of the soft fudge very well. My only gripe is that the chocolate chips and the chocolate fudge create too many somewhat clashing textures. I think the cookie would be better if it had just the fudge inside the cookie without the chocolate chips.

The cookies are fine. A bit too sweet for my taste, but I really had to force myself to try one. Getting cookies shipped to you is NOT the way to go. Let's just say it was a cookie LOAF not individual cookies. Everything had melted together by the time they got to me in the mail. They were probably sitting in some mail truck for six hours re-baking. I don't think I can give a proper review for this one.
